sentences.en: We can read of things that happened 5, 000 years ago in the Near East,
sentences.native: 我们可以读到五千年前在近东发生的事情，

sentences.en: where people first learned to write.
sentences.native: 人们最初学会写作的​​地方。

sentences.en: But there are some parts of the world where even now people cannot write.
sentences.native: 但世界上有些地方至今仍无法书写。

sentences.en: The only way that they can preserve their history is to recount it as sagas legends handed down from one generation of storytellers to another.
sentences.native: 他们保存历史的唯一方法就是将其作为传奇故事从一代讲故事者流传到另一代人。

sentences.en: These legends are useful because they can tell us something about migrations of people who lived long ago,
sentences.native: 这些传说很有用，因为它们可以告诉我们一些关于很久以前生活的人们的迁徙的信息，

sentences.en: but none could write down what they did.
sentences.native: 但没有人能写下他们做了什么。

sentences.en: Anthropologists wondered where the remote ancestors of the Polynesian peoples now living in the Pacific Islandscame from.
sentences.native: 人类学家想知道现在生活在太平洋岛屿上的波利尼西亚人的远祖来自哪里。

sentences.en: The sagas of these people explain that some of them came from Indonesia about 2, 000 years ago.
sentences.native: 这些人的传奇故事表明，他们中的一些人大约在 2000 年前来自印度尼西亚。

sentences.en: But the first people who were like ourselves lived so long ago that even their sagas, if they had any, are forgotten.
sentences.native: 但最早像我们一样的人生活在很久以前，甚至连他们的传奇故事（如果有的话）也被遗忘了。

sentences.en: So archaeologists have neither history nor legends to help them to find out where the first 'modern men' came from.
sentences.native: 因此，考古学家既没有历史也没有传说来帮助他们找出第一批“现代人”的来源。

sentences.en: Fortunately, however, ancient men made tools of stone, especially flint,
sentences.native: 然而幸运的是，古人制造了石制工具，尤其是燧石，

sentences.en: because this is easier to shape than other kinds.
sentences.native: 因为这种比其他种类更容易成型。

sentences.en: They may also have used wood and skins, but these have rotted away.
sentences.native: 他们也可能使用木头和兽皮，但这些都已经腐烂了。

sentences.en: Stone does not decay, and so the tools of long ago have remained when even the bones of the men who made them have disappeared without trace.
sentences.native: 石头不会腐烂，因此很久以前的工具仍然存在，即使制造它们的人的骨头也消失得无影无踪。

sentences.en: Because they destroy so many insects, and insects include some of the greatest enemies of the human race.
sentences.native: 因为它们消灭了如此多的昆虫，而昆虫中包括一些人类最大的敌人。

sentences.en: Insects would make it impossible for us to live in the world;
sentences.native: 昆虫会让我们无法在这个世界上生存；

sentences.en: they would devour all our crops and kill our flocks and herds,
sentences.native: 他们会吃掉我们所有的庄稼，杀死我们的牛羊，

sentences.en: if it were not for the protection we get from insect eating animals.
sentences.native: 如果不是为了保护我们免受食虫动物的侵害。

sentences.en: We owe a lot to the birds and beasts who eat insects
sentences.native: 我们亏欠吃昆虫的飞禽走兽

sentences.en: but all of them put together kill only a fraction of the number destroyed by spiders.
sentences.native: 但所有这些加起来只杀死了被蜘蛛消灭的一小部分。

sentences.en: Moreover, unlike some of the other insect eaters, spiders never do the least harm to us or our belongings.
sentences.native: 此外，与其他一些食虫动物不同，蜘蛛永远不会对我们或我们的财产造成最小的伤害。

sentences.en: Spiders are not insects, as many people think, nor even nearly related to them.
sentences.native: 正如许多人认为的那样，蜘蛛不是昆虫，甚至与昆虫也没有近亲关系。

sentences.en: One can tell the difference almost at a glance, for a spider always has eight legs and an insect never more than six.
sentences.native: 人们几乎一眼就能看出区别，因为蜘蛛总是有八条腿，而昆虫永远不会超过六条。

sentences.en: How many spiders are engaged in this work on our behalf?
sentences.native: 有多少蜘蛛代表我们从事这项工作？

sentences.en: One authority on spiders made a census of the spiders in a grass field in the south of England,
sentences.native: 一位蜘蛛研究权威对英格兰南部一片草地上的蜘蛛进行了普查，

sentences.en: and he estimated that there were more than 2, 250, 000 in one acre;
sentences.native: 他估计一英亩地里有2、250、000多个；

sentences.en: that is something like 6, 000, 000 spiders of different kinds on a football pitch.
sentences.native: 相当于足球场上有 6, 000, 000 只不同种类的蜘蛛。

sentences.en: Spiders are busy for at least half the year in killing insects.
sentences.native: 蜘蛛至少有半年时间忙于捕杀昆虫。

sentences.en: It is impossible to make more than the wildest guess at how many they kill, but they are hungry creatures, not content with only three meals a day.
sentences.native: 我们无法对它们杀死的数量做出最疯狂的猜测，但它们是饥饿的生物，不满足于一日三餐。

sentences.en: It has been estimated that the weight of all the insects destroyed by spiders in Britain in one year would be greater than the total weight of all the human beings in the country.
sentences.native: 据估计，英国一年内被蜘蛛消灭的所有昆虫的重量将超过该国所有人类的总重量。

sentences.en: Modern alpinists try to climb mountains by a route which will give them good sport,
sentences.native: 现代登山运动员试图通过一条能给他们带来良好运动的路线来攀登山脉，

sentences.en: and the more difficult it is, the more highly it is regarded.
sentences.native: 越是困难，就越受重视。

sentences.en: In the pioneering days however, this was not the case at all.
sentences.native: 然而，在开拓时期，情况根本不是这样。

sentences.en: The early climbers were looking for the easiest way to the top because the summit was the prize they sought,
sentences.native: 早期的登山者正在寻找最简单的登顶方法，因为顶峰是他们寻求的奖品，

sentences.en: especially if it had never been attained before.
sentences.native: 尤其是如果以前从未实现过的话。

sentences.en: It is true that during their explorations they often faced difficulties and dangers of the most perilous nature,
sentences.native: 确实，他们在探索过程中经常面临最危险的困难和危险，

sentences.en: equipped in a manner which would make a modern climber shudder at the thought,
sentences.native: 装备的方式会让现代登山者一想到就会不寒而栗，

sentences.en: but they did not go out of their way to court such excitement.
sentences.native: 但他们并没有特意去追求这种兴奋。

sentences.en: They had a single aim, a solitary goal -- the top!
sentences.native: 他们只有一个目标，一个唯一的目标——登顶！

sentences.en: It is hard for us to realize nowadays how difficult it was for the pioneers.
sentences.native: 现在我们很难体会到先驱者们的艰辛。

sentences.en: Except for one or two places such as Zermatt and Chamonix, which had rapidly become popular.
sentences.native: 除了采尔马特、霞慕尼等一两个地方迅速走红。

sentences.en: Alpine villages tended to be impoverished settlements cut off from civilization by the high mountains.
sentences.native: 高山村庄往往是被高山与文明隔绝的贫困聚居区。

sentences.en: Such inns as there were were generally dirty and flea-ridden;
sentences.native: 那里的旅馆一般都很脏，而且跳蚤猖獗。

sentences.en: the food simply local cheese accompanied by bread often twelve months old,
sentences.native: 食物只是当地的奶酪，搭配通常十二个月大的面包，

sentences.en: all washed down with coarse wine.
sentences.native: 皆以粗酒冲下。

sentences.en: Often a valley boasted no inn at all, and climbers found shelter wherever they could --
sentences.native: 通常，一个山谷根本没有旅馆，登山者会尽可能地寻找庇护所——

sentences.en: sometimes with the local priest (who was usually as poor as his parishioners),
sentences.native: 有时与当地的牧师（他通常和他的教区居民一样贫穷）一起，

sentences.en: sometimes with shepherds or cheese-makers.
sentences.native: 有时与牧羊人或奶酪制造商一起。

sentences.en: Invariably the background was the same:dirt and poverty, and very uncomfortable.
sentences.native: 背景总是一样的：肮脏、贫穷，而且非常不舒服。

sentences.en: For men accustomed to eating seven-course dinners and sleeping between fine linen sheets at home,
sentences.native: 对于习惯于吃七道菜晚餐并在家中睡在细亚麻床单之间的男士来说，

sentences.en: the change to the Alps must have been very hard indeed.
sentences.native: 阿尔卑斯山的变化确实非常艰难。

sentences.en: Several cases have been reported in Russia recently of people who can read and detect colours with their fingers, and even see through solid doors and walls.
sentences.native: 最近，俄罗斯报道了几起案例，人们可以用手指阅读和检测颜色，甚至可以透过坚固的门和墙壁看到东西。

sentences.en: One case concerns an 11-year-old schoolgirl Vera Petrova,
sentences.native: 其中一个案例涉及一名 11 岁女学生维拉·佩特洛娃 (Vera Petrova)，

sentences.en: who has normal vision but who can also perceive things with different parts of her skin, and through solid walls.
sentences.native: 她有正常的视力，但也能用皮肤的不同部分以及透过坚固的墙壁感知事物。

sentences.en: This ability was first noticed by her father.
sentences.native: 这种能力首先被她的父亲注意到。

sentences.en: One day she came into his office and happened to put her hands on the door of a locked safe.
sentences.native: 有一天，她走进他的办公室，碰巧把手放在了锁着的保险箱的门上。

sentences.en: Suddenly she asked her father why he kept so many old newspapers locked away there,
sentences.native: 突然她问父亲为什么要把这么多旧报纸锁在那里，

sentences.en: and even described the way they were done up in bundles.
sentences.native: 甚至还描述了它们是如何捆扎起来的。

sentences.en: Vera's curious talent was brought to the notice of a scientific research institute in the town of Ulyanovsk, near where she lives,
sentences.native: 薇拉的好奇天赋引起了她居住地附近乌里扬诺夫斯克镇一家科学研究所的注意，

sentences.en: and in April she was given a series of tests by a special commission of the Ministry of Health of the Russian Federal Republic.
sentences.native: 4月，俄罗斯联邦共和国卫生部的一个特别委员会对她进行了一系列检查。

sentences.en: During these tests she was able to read a newspaper through an opaque screen and, stranger still,
sentences.native: 在这些测试中，她能够通过不透明的屏幕阅读报纸，而且更奇怪的是，

sentences.en: by moving her elbow over a child's game of Lotto she was able to describe the figures and colours printed on it;
sentences.native: 通过将她的肘部移到儿童的乐透游戏上，她能够描述上面印着的数字和颜色；

sentences.en: and, in another instance, wearing stockings and slippers,
sentences.native: 在另一个例子中，穿着丝袜和拖鞋，

sentences.en: to make out with her foot the outlines and colours of a picture hidden under a carpet.
sentences.native: 用她的脚辨认出隐藏在地毯下的图画的轮廓和颜色。

sentences.en: Other experiments showed that her knees and shoulders had a similar sensitivity.
sentences.native: 其他实验表明她的膝盖和肩膀也有类似的敏感性。

sentences.en: During all these tests Vera was blindfold; and indeed, except when blindfold she lacked the ability to perceive things with her skin.
sentences.native: 在所有这些测试中，维拉都被蒙住眼睛。事实上，除了蒙上眼睛之外，她缺乏用皮肤感知事物的能力。

sentences.en: It was also found that although she could perceive things with her fingers this ability ceased the moment her hands were wet.
sentences.native: 研究还发现，尽管她可以用手指感知事物，但一旦手湿了，这种能力就消失了。

sentences.en: People are always talking about 'the problem of youth'.
sentences.native: 人们总是在谈论“青年问题”。

sentences.en: If there is one -- which I take leave to doubt
sentences.native: 如果有的话——我对此表示怀疑

sentences.en: -- then it is older people who create it, not the young themselves.
sentences.native: ——那么创造它的是老年人，而不是年轻人自己。

sentences.en: Let us get down to fundamentals and agree that the young are after all human beings
sentences.native: 让我们脚踏实地，承认年轻人毕竟是人

sentences.en: -- people just like their elders.
sentences.native: ——人们就像他们的长辈一样。

sentences.en: There is only one difference between an old man and a young one:
sentences.native: 老人和年轻人之间只有一个区别：

sentences.en: the young man has a glorious future before him
sentences.native: 这个年轻人有着光明的未来

sentences.en: and the old one has a splendid future behind him: and maybe that is where the rub is.
sentences.native: 而老家伙的身后有着辉煌的未来：也许这就是问题所在。

sentences.en: When I was a teenager, I felt that I was just young and uncertain --
sentences.native: 当我十几岁的时候，我觉得我只是年轻而不确定——

sentences.en: that I was a new boy in a huge school,
sentences.native: 我是一所大学校的新生，

sentences.en: and I would have been very pleased to be regarded as something so interesting as a problem.
sentences.native: 如果我被视为一个像问题一样有趣的东西，我会非常高兴。

sentences.en: For one thing, being a problem gives you a certain identity,
sentences.native: 一方面，成为一个问题会给你一个特定的身份，

sentences.en: and that is one of the things the young are busily engaged in seeking.
sentences.native: 这正是年轻人忙于寻求的事情之一。

sentences.en: I find young people exciting.
sentences.native: 我发现年轻人令人兴奋。

sentences.en: They have an air of freedom,
sentences.native: 他们有一种自由的气息，

sentences.en: and they have not a dreary commitment to mean ambitions or love of comfort.
sentences.native: 他们不会沉闷地追求卑鄙的野心或贪图安逸。

sentences.en: They are not anxious social climbers, and they have no devotion to material things.
sentences.native: 他们不是焦虑的社会攀登者，也不热衷于物质事物。

sentences.en: All this seems to me to link them with life and the origins of things.
sentences.native: 在我看来，这一切都将它们与生命和事物的起源联系起来。

sentences.en: It's as if they were in some sense cosmic beings in violent and lovely contrast with us suburban creatures.
sentences.native: 就好像他们在某种意义上是宇宙生物，与我们郊区的生物形成了暴力而可爱的对比。

sentences.en: All that is in my mind when I meet a young person.
sentences.native: 当我遇到一个年轻人时，所有这些都在我的脑海里。

sentences.en: He may be conceited, ill-mannered,  presumptuous or fatuous,  but I do not turn for protection to dreary cliches about respect for elders --
sentences.native: 他可能自负、无礼、自以为是或愚蠢，但我不会求助于关于尊重长辈的沉闷陈词滥调——

sentences.en: as if mere age were a reason for respect.
sentences.native: 就好像年龄本身就是受到尊重的理由。

sentences.en: I accept that we are equals, and I will argue with him, as an equal, if I think he is wrong.
sentences.native: 我承认我们是平等的，如果我认为他错了，我会作为平等的人与他争论。

sentences.en: I am always amazed when I hear people saying that sport creates goodwill between the nations, and that if only the common peoples of the world could meet one another at football or cricket, they would have no inclination to meet on the battlefield.
sentences.native: 当我听到人们说体育可以在国家之间建立友好关系，如果世界人民能够在足球或板球比赛中相遇，他们就不会愿意在战场上相遇，我总是感到惊讶。

sentences.en: Even if one didn't know from concrete examples (the 1936 Olympic Games, for instance) that international sporting contests lead to orgies of hatred, one could deduce it from general principles.
sentences.native: 即使人们无法从具体例子（例如 1936 年奥运会）中了解到国际体育竞赛会导致仇恨狂欢，人们也可以从一般原则中推断出这一点。

sentences.en: Nearly all the sports practised nowadays are competitive.
sentences.native: 当今几乎所有的运动都是竞技性的。

sentences.en: You play to win, and the game has little meaning unless you do your utmost to win.
sentences.native: 你玩游戏就是为了赢，除非你竭尽全力去赢，否则游戏就没有意义。

sentences.en: On the village green, where you pick up sides and no feeling of local patriotism is involved, it is possible to play simply for the fun and exercise: but as soon as a the question of prestige arises, as soon as you feel that you and some larger unit will be disgraced if you lose, the most savage combative instincts are aroused.
sentences.native: 在乡村绿地里，你站在一边，不涉及当地的爱国主义感情，你可以纯粹为了乐趣和锻炼而打球：但一旦出现声望问题，一旦你觉得如果你输了，你和一些更大的单位就会蒙羞，最野蛮的好斗本能就会被唤起。

sentences.en: Anyone who has played even in a school football match knows this.
sentences.native: 任何参加过学校足球比赛的人都知道这一点。

sentences.en: At the international level, sport is frankly mimic warfare.
sentences.native: 在国际层面，体育运动坦率地说是模仿战争。

sentences.en: But the significant thing is not the behaviour of the players but the attitude of the spectators:
sentences.native: 但重要的不是球员的行为，而是观众的态度：

sentences.en: and, behind the spectators, of the nations who work themselves into furies over these absurd contests,
sentences.native: 在观众的背后，是那些对这些荒谬的竞赛感到愤怒的国家，

sentences.en: and seriously believe -- at any rate for short periods -- that running, jumping and kicking a ball are tests of national virtue.
sentences.native: 并坚信——至少在短期内——跑、跳、踢球是对民族美德的考验。

sentences.en: Not all sounds made by animals serve as language, and we have only to turn to that extraordinary discovery of echo-location in bats to see a case in which the voice plays a strictly utilitarian role.
sentences.native: 并非动物发出的所有声音都可以用作语言，我们只需求助于蝙蝠回声定位的非凡发现，就能看到声音发挥严格功利作用的情况。

sentences.en: To get a full appreciation of what this means we must turn first to some recent human inventions.
sentences.native: 为了充分理解这意味着什么，我们必须首先回顾一些人类最近的发明。

sentences.en: Everyone knows that if he shouts in the vicinity of a wall or a mountainside, an echo will come back.
sentences.native: 大家都知道，如果他在墙壁或山腰附近喊叫，就会有回声回来。

sentences.en: The further off this solid obstruction, the longer time will elapse for the return of the echo.
sentences.native: 距离固体障碍物越远，回声返回所需的时间就越长。

sentences.en: A sound made by tapping on the hull of a ship will be reflected from the sea bottom, and by measuring the time interval between the taps and the receipt of the echoes the depth of the sea at that point can be calculated.
sentences.native: 敲击船体发出的声音会从海底反射出来，通过测量敲击和接收回声之间的时间间隔，可以计算出该点的海水深度。

sentences.en: So was born the echo-sounding apparatus, now in general use in ships.
sentences.native: 回声探测装置就这样诞生了，现在在船舶上普遍使用。

sentences.en: Every solid object will reflect a sound, varying according to the size and nature of the object.
sentences.native: 每个固体物体都会反射声音，声音根据物体的大小和性质而变化。

sentences.en: A shoal of fish will do this.
sentences.native: 一群鱼就能做到这一点。

sentences.en: So it is a comparatively simple step from locating the sea bottom to locating a shoal of fish.
sentences.native: 因此，从定位海底到定位鱼群是一个相对简单的步骤。

sentences.en: With experience, and with improved apparatus, it is now possible not only to locate a shoal but to tell if it is herring, cod, or other well-known fish, by the pattern of its echo.
sentences.native: 凭借经验和改进的设备，现在不仅可以定位浅滩，还可以通过回声模式判断它是否是鲱鱼、鳕鱼或其他众所周知的鱼类。

sentences.en: It has been found that certain bats emit squeaks and by receiving the echoes,
sentences.native: 研究发现，某些蝙蝠会发出吱吱声，并通过接收回声，

sentences.en: they can locate and steer clear of obstacles -- or locate flying insects on which they feed.
sentences.native: 它们可以定位并避开障碍物，或者定位它们赖以生存的飞行昆虫。

sentences.en: This echo-location in bats is often compared with radar, the principle of which is similar.
sentences.native: 蝙蝠的这种回声定位通常与雷达进行比较，其原理相似。

sentences.en: Chickens slaughtered in the United States, claim officials in Brussels, are not fit to grace European tables.
sentences.native: 布鲁塞尔官员声称，在美国屠宰的鸡不适合登上欧洲餐桌。

sentences.en: No, say the Americans: our fowl are fine, we simply clean them in a different way.
sentences.native: 不，美国人说：我们的家禽很好，我们只是用不同的方式清洁它们。

sentences.en: These days, it is differences in national regulations, far more than tariffs, that put sand in the wheels of trade between rich countries.
sentences.native: 如今，让富裕国家之间的贸易车轮陷入困境的，是国家法规的差异，而不仅仅是关税。

sentences.en: It is not just farmers who are complaining.
sentences.native: 抱怨的不仅仅是农民。

sentences.en: An electric razor that meets the European Union's safety standards must be approved by American testers before it can be sold in the United States, and an American-made dialysis machine needs the EU's okay before it hits the market in Europe.
sentences.native: 一款符合欧盟安全标准的电动剃须刀必须经过美国测试人员的批准才能在美国销售，而美国制造的透析机则需要获得欧盟的批准才能进入欧洲市场。

sentences.en: As it happens, a razor that is safe in Europe is unlikely to electrocute Americans.
sentences.native: 事实上，在欧洲安全的剃须刀不太可能让美国人触电身亡。

sentences.en: So, ask businesses on both sides of the Atlantic, why have two lots of tests where one would do?
sentences.native: 那么，问问大西洋两岸的企业，为什么要进行两次测试，而一次测试就可以呢？

sentences.en: Politicians agree, in principle, so America and the EU have been trying to reach a deal which would eliminate the need to double-test many products.
sentences.native: 政界人士原则上同意，因此美国和欧盟一直在努力达成一项协议，以消除对许多产品进行双重测试的需要。

sentences.en: They hope to finish in time for a trade summit between America and the EU on May 28th.
sentences.native: 他们希望能在 5 月 28 日举行的美国和欧盟贸易峰会前及时结束。

sentences.en: Although negotiators are optimistic, the details are complex enough that they may be hard-pressed to get a deal at all.
sentences.native: 尽管谈判代表很乐观，但细节足够复杂，他们可能很难达成协议。

sentences.en: Why? One difficulty is to construct the agreements.
sentences.native: 为什么？一个困难是制定协议。

sentences.en: The Americans would happily reach one accord on standards for medical devices and then hammer out different pacts covering, say, electronic goods and drug manufacturing.
sentences.native: 美国人很乐意就医疗设备标准达成一项协议，然后敲定涵盖电子产品和药品制造等领域的不同协议。

sentences.en: The EU -- following fine continental traditions -- wants agreement on general principles,
sentences.native: 欧盟遵循欧洲大陆的优良传统，希望就一般原则达成一致，

sentences.en: which could be applied to many types of products and perhaps extended to other countries.
sentences.native: 这可以应用于多种类型的产品，或许还可以扩展到其他国家。

sentences.en: Alfred the Great acted as his own spy, visiting Danish camps disguised as a minstrel.
sentences.native: 阿尔弗雷德大帝充当自己的间谍，伪装成吟游诗人访问丹麦营地。

sentences.en: In those days wandering minstrels were welcome everywhere.
sentences.native: 那时，流浪的吟游诗人到处都受到欢迎。

sentences.en: They were not fighting men, and their harp was their passport.
sentences.native: 他们不是战士，他们的竖琴就是他们的护照。

sentences.en: Alfred had learned many of their ballads in his youth and could vary his programme with acrobatic tricks and simple conjuring.
sentences.native: 阿尔弗雷德年轻时就学过他们的许多歌谣，并且可以通过杂技技巧和简单的魔术来改变他的节目。

sentences.en: While Alfred's little army slowly began to gather at Athelney, the king himself set out to penetrate the camp of Guthrum, the commander of the Danish invaders.
sentences.native: 当阿尔弗雷德的小军队开始慢慢地在阿瑟尔尼集结时，国王亲自出发渗透丹麦入侵者指挥官古斯鲁姆的营地。

sentences.en: These had settled down for the winter at Chippenham: thither Alfred went.
sentences.native: 他们在奇彭纳姆定居过冬：阿尔弗雷德去了那里。

sentences.en: He noticed at once that discipline was slack: the Danes had the self-confidence of conquerors, and their security precautions were casual.
sentences.native: 他立刻注意到纪律松懈：丹麦人有着征服者般的自信，他们的安全预防措施也很随意。

sentences.en: They lived well, on the proceeds of raids on neighbouring regions.
sentences.native: 他们靠袭击邻近地区的收入过着很好的生活。

sentences.en: There they collected women as well as food and drink, and a life of ease had made them soft.
sentences.native: 他们在那里收集女人以及食物和饮料，安逸的生活使他们变得柔软。

sentences.en: Alfred stayed in the camp a week before he returned to Athelney.
sentences.native: 阿尔弗雷德在返回阿瑟尔尼之前在营地待了一周。

sentences.en: The force there assembled was trivial compared with the Danish horde.
sentences.native: 与丹麦游牧部落相比，那里集结的兵力微不足道。

sentences.en: But Alfred had deduced that the Danes were no longer fit for prolonged battle: and that their commissariat had no organization, but depended on irregular raids.
sentences.native: 但阿尔弗雷德推断丹麦人不再适合长期战斗：他们的粮食部门没有组织，只能依靠不定期的袭击。

sentences.en: So, faced with the Danish advance, Alfred did not risk open battle but harried the enemy.
sentences.native: 因此，面对丹麦人的进攻，阿尔弗雷德没有冒险公开战斗，而是骚扰敌人。

sentences.en: He was constantly on the move, drawing the Danes after him.
sentences.native: 他不断地移动，吸引着丹麦人追随他。

sentences.en: His patrols halted the raiding parties: hunger assailed the Danish army.
sentences.native: 他的巡逻阻止了突袭队伍：饥饿袭击了丹麦军队。

sentences.en: Now Alfred began a long series of skirmishes -- and within a month the Danes had surrendered.
sentences.native: 现在阿尔弗雷德开始了一系列的小冲突——不到一个月，丹麦人就投降了。

sentences.en: The episode could reasonably serve as a unique epic of royal espionage!
sentences.native: 这一集可以说是一部独特的皇家间谍史诗！

sentences.en: Technology trends may push Silicon Valley back to the future.
sentences.native: 技术趋势可能会推动硅谷回到未来。

sentences.en: Carver Mead, a pioneer in integrated circuits and a professor of computer science at the California Institute of Technology, notes there are now workstations that enable engineers to design, test and produce chips right on their desks, much the way and editor creates a newsletter on a Macintosh.
sentences.native: 集成电路先驱、加州理工学院计算机科学教授卡弗·米德 (Carver Mead) 指出，现在的工作站使工程师能够在办公桌上设计、测试和生产芯片，就像编辑在 Macintosh 上创建时事通讯一样。

sentences.en: As the time and cost of making a chip drop to a few days and a few hundred dollars, engineers may soon be free to let their imaginations soar without being penalized by expensive failures.
sentences.native: 随着制造芯片的时间和成本下降到几天和几百美元，工程师可能很快就可以自由地发挥他们的想象力，而不会因昂贵的故障而受到惩罚。

sentences.en: Mead predicts that inventors will be able to perfect powerful customized chips over a weekend at the office --
sentences.native: 米德预测，发明家将能够在办公室一个周末完善强大的定制芯片——

sentences.en: spawning a new generation of garage start-ups and giving the U. S.  a jump on its foreign rivals in getting new products to market fast.
sentences.native: 催生了新一代的车库初创企业，并使美国在将新产品快速推向市场方面领先于外国竞争对手。

sentences.en: 'We've got more garages with smart people,' Mead observes. 'We really thrive on anarchy. '
sentences.native: “我们有更多的车库，里面都是聪明人，”米德说。 “我们确实在无政府状态下茁壮成长。 '

sentences.en: And on Asians. Already, orientals and Asian Americans constitute the majority of the engineering staffs at many Valley firms.
sentences.native: 还有亚洲人。东方人和亚裔美国人已经成为硅谷许多公司工程人员的主体。

sentences.en: And Chinese, Korean, Filipino and Indian engineers are graduating in droves from California's colleges.
sentences.native: 中国、韩国、菲律宾和印度工程师正成群结队地从加州大学毕业。

sentences.en: As the heads of next-generation start-ups, these Asian innovators can draw on customs and languages to forge tighter links with crucial Pacific Rim markets.
sentences.native: 作为下一代初创企业的负责人，这些亚洲创新者可以利用习俗和语言与重要的环太平洋市场建立更紧密的联系。

sentences.en: For instance, Alex Au, a Stanford Ph. D. from Hong Kong, has set up a Taiwan factory to challenge Japan's near lock on the memory-chip market.
sentences.native: 例如，来自香港的斯坦福大学博士 Alex Au 就在台湾设立了一家工厂，以挑战日本几乎垄断的存储芯片市场。

sentences.en: India-born N. Damodar Reddy's tiny California company reopened an AT&T chip plant in Kansas City last spring with financing from the state of Missouri.
sentences.native: 去年春天，印度出生的达莫达尔·雷迪 (N. Damodar Reddy) 的加州小公司在密苏里州的资助下，在堪萨斯城重新开设了一家 AT&T 芯片工厂。

sentences.en: Before it becomes a retirement village, Silicon Valley may prove a classroom for building a global business.
sentences.native: 在成为退休村之前，硅谷可能会成为建立全球企业的课堂。

sentences.en: Some old people are oppressed by the fear of death.
sentences.native: 一些老人因对死亡的恐惧而感到压抑。

sentences.en: In the young there is a justification for this feeling.
sentences.native: 对于年轻人来说，这种感觉是有道理的。

sentences.en: Young men who have reason to fear that they will be killed in battle
sentences.native: 有理由担心自己会在战斗中阵亡的年轻人

sentences.en: may justifiably feel bitter in the thought
sentences.native: 可能有理由感到痛苦

sentences.en: that they have been cheated of the best things that life has to offer.
sentences.native: 他们被欺骗了，失去了生活所能提供的最好的东西。

sentences.en: But in an old man who has known human joys and sorrows,
sentences.native: 但在一个懂得人间悲欢离合的老人身上，

sentences.en: and has achieved whatever work it was in him to do,
sentences.native: 并完成了他想做的任何工作，

sentences.en: the fear of death is somewhat abject and ignoble.
sentences.native: 对死亡的恐惧是有点卑鄙和不光彩的。

sentences.en: The best way to overcome it--so at least it seems to me--
sentences.native: 克服它的最好方法——至少在我看来——

sentences.en: is to make your interests gradually wider and more impersonal,
sentences.native: 就是让你的兴趣逐渐更广泛、更客观，

sentences.en: until bit by bit the walls of the ego recede,
sentences.native: 直到自我的围墙一点点退去，

sentences.en: and your life becomes increasingly merged in the universal life.
sentences.native: 你的生活会越来越融入普遍的生活。

sentences.en: An individual human existence should be like a river--
sentences.native: 一个人的存在应该像一条河流——

sentences.en: small at first, narrowly contained within its banks,
sentences.native: 起初很小，狭窄地包含在河岸内，

sentences.en: and rushing passionately past boulders and over waterfalls.
sentences.native: 并热情地冲过巨石和瀑布。

sentences.en: Gradually the river grows wider, the banks recede, the waters flow more quietly,
sentences.native: 河水渐渐变宽，河岸退去，水流更加平静，

sentences.en: and in the end, without any visiblebreak, they become merged in the sea,
sentences.native: 最后，没有任何明显的断裂，它们融入了大海，

sentences.en: and painlessly lose their individual being.
sentences.native: 并毫无痛苦地失去他们的个体存在。

sentences.en: The man who, in old age can see his life in this way,
sentences.native: 一个人在年老时还能这样看待自己的生活，

sentences.en: will not suffer from the fear of death,
sentences.native: 不会因死亡的恐惧而痛苦，

sentences.en: since the things he cares for will continue.
sentences.native: 因为他所关心的事情将会继续下去。

sentences.en: And if, with the decay of vitality, weariness increases,
sentences.native: 如果随着活力的衰退而疲倦增加，

sentences.en: the thought of rest will be not unwelcome.
sentences.native: 休息的想法不会不受欢迎。

sentences.en: I should wish to die while still at work,
sentences.native: 我宁愿死在工作中，

sentences.en: knowing that others will carry on what I can no longer do,
sentences.native: 知道其他人会继续我不能再做的事情，

sentences.en: and content in the thought that what was possible has been done.
sentences.native: 并满足于认为可能的事情已经完成。

sentences.en: When anyone opens a current account at a bank, he is lending the bank money,
sentences.native: 当任何人在银行开设活期账户时，他就是在借钱给银行，

sentences.en: repayment of which he may demand at any time either in cash or by drawing a cheque in favour of another person.
sentences.native: 他可以随时以现金或开具他人支票的方式要求偿还。

sentences.en: Primarily, the banker-customer relationship is that of debtor and creditor--
sentences.native: 首先，银行与客户的关系是债务人和债权人的关系——

sentences.en: who is which depending on whether the customer's account is in credit or is overdrawn.
sentences.native: 谁是谁，取决于客户的账户是有信用还是透支。

sentences.en: But, in addition to that basically simple concept,
sentences.native: 但是，除了这个基本简单的概念之外，

sentences.en: the bank and its customer owe a large number of obligations to one another.
sentences.native: 银行及其客户彼此负有大量义务。

sentences.en: Many of these obligations can give rise to problems and complications but a bank customer, unlike, say, a buyer of goods,
sentences.native: 其中许多义务可能会引起问题和复杂化，但银行客户与商品买家不同，

sentences.en: cannot complain that the law is loaded against him.
sentences.native: 不能抱怨法律对他不利。

sentences.en: The bank must obey its customer's instructions, and not those of anyone else.
sentences.native: 银行必须服从客户的指示，而不是其他任何人的指示。

sentences.en: When, for example, a customer first opens an account, he instructs the bank to debit his account only in respect of cheques drawn by himself.
sentences.native: 例如，当客户第一次开立账户时，他指示银行仅将自己开出的支票从其账户中扣除。

sentences.en: He gives the bank specimens of his signature, and there is a very firm rule
sentences.native: 他给银行签名样本，有一个非常严格的规则

sentences.en: that the bank has no right or authority to pay out a customer's money on a cheque
sentences.native: 银行无权或授权通过支票支付客户的钱

sentences.en: on which its customer's signature has been forged.
sentences.native: 其客户签名已被伪造。

sentences.en: It makes no difference that the forgery may have been a very skillful one:
sentences.native: 毫无疑问，伪造可能是一件非常熟练的事情：

sentences.en: the bank must recognize its customer's signature.
sentences.native: 银行必须识别其客户的签名。

sentences.en: For this reason there is no risk to the customer in the practice, adopted by banks, of printing the customer's name on his cheques.
sentences.native: 因此，银行在支票上印上客户姓名的做法不会给客户带来任何风险。

sentences.en: If this facilitates forgery, it is the bank which will lose, not the customer.
sentences.native: 如果这有利于伪造，损失的是银行，而不是客户。

sentences.en: The deepest holes of all are made for oil, and they go down to as much as 25, 000 feet.
sentences.native: 最深的洞是为了石油而挖的，深达 25, 000 英尺。

sentences.en: But we do not need to send man down to get the oil out, as we must with other mineral deposits.
sentences.native: 但我们不需要像开采其他矿藏那样派人下去开采石油。

sentences.en: The holes are only borings, less than a foot in diameter.
sentences.native: 这些孔只是钻孔，直径不到一英尺。

sentences.en: My particular experience is largely in oil, and the search for oil has done more to improve deep drilling than any other mining activity.
sentences.native: 我的特殊经验主要是在石油方面，与任何其他采矿活动相比，寻找石油对改善深钻探的贡献更大。

sentences.en: When it has been decided where we are going to drill,
sentences.native: 当我们决定要在哪里进行钻探时

sentences.en: we put up at the surface an oil derrick.
sentences.native: 我们在地面搭建了一个石油井架。

sentences.en: It has to be tall because it is like a giant block and tackle and we have to lower into the ground
sentences.native: 它必须很高，因为它就像一个巨大的滑轮组，我们必须降低到地面

sentences.en: and haul out of the ground great lengths of drill pipe which are rotated by an engine at the top
sentences.native: 然后将长长的钻杆从地面拖出，这些钻杆由顶部的发动机旋转

sentences.en: and are fitted with a cutting bit at the bottom.
sentences.native: 并在底部装有切割头。

sentences.en: The geologist needs to know what rocks the drill has reached,
sentences.native: 地质学家需要知道钻头已经到达了哪些岩石，

sentences.en: so every so often a sample is obtained with a coring bit.
sentences.native: 因此，时常使用取芯钻头获取样本。

sentences.en: It cuts a clean cylinder of rock, from which can be seen the strata the drill has been cutting through.
sentences.native: 它切割出一个干净的圆柱体岩石，从中可以看到钻头已经切割过的地层。

sentences.en: Once we get down to the oil, it usually flows to the surface because great pressure either from gas or water, is pushing it.
sentences.native: 一旦我们到达石油，它通常会流到地表，因为来自气体或水的巨大压力正在推动它。

sentences.en: This pressure must be under control, and we control it by means of the mud which we circulate down the drill pipe.
sentences.native: 该压力必须受到控制，我们通过沿着钻杆循环的泥浆来控制它。

sentences.en: We endeavour to avoid the old, romantic idea of a gusher, which wastes oil and gas.
sentences.native: 我们努力避免传统的、浪漫的喷井观念，因为这种观念会浪费石油和天然气。

sentences.en: We want it to stay down the hole until we can lead it off in a controlled manner.
sentences.native: 我们希望它留在洞里，直到我们能够以受控的方式引导它离开。

sentences.en: Beyond two or three days, the world's best weather forecasts are speculative,
sentences.native: 超过两三天，世界上最好的天气预报都是推测性的，

sentences.en: and beyond six or seven they are worthless.
sentences.native: 超过六七个就毫无价值了。

sentences.en: The Butterfly Effect is the reason.
sentences.native: 蝴蝶效应就是原因。

sentences.en: For small pieces of weather--
sentences.native: 对于小天气——

sentences.en: and to a global forecaster, small can mean thunderstorms and blizzards--
sentences.native: 对于全球预报员来说，小雨可能意味着雷暴和暴风雪——

sentences.en: any prediction deteriorates rapidly.
sentences.native: 任何预测都会迅速恶化。

sentences.en: Errors and uncertainties multiply, cascading upward through a chain of turbulent features,
sentences.native: 错误和不确定性成倍增加，通过一系列动荡的特征向上级联，

sentences.en: from dust devils and squalls up to continent-size eddies that only satellites can see.
sentences.native: 从尘暴和暴风雨到只有卫星才能看到的大陆大小的漩涡。

sentences.en: The modern weather models work with a grid of points of the order of sixty miles apart,
sentences.native: 现代天气模型使用相距六十英里的点网格，

sentences.en: and even so, some starting data has to be guessed,
sentences.native: 即便如此，也必须猜测一些起始数据，

sentences.en: since ground stations and satellites cannot see everywhere.
sentences.native: 因为地面站和卫星无法看到所有地方。

sentences.en: But suppose the earth could be covered with sensors spaced one foot apart,
sentences.native: 但假设地球上布满了​​间隔一英尺的传感器，

sentences.en: rising at one-foot intervals all the way to the top of the atmosphere.
sentences.native: 以一英尺的间隔一直上升到大气层的顶部。

sentences.en: Suppose every sensor gives perfectly accurate readings of temperature,
sentences.native: 假设每个传感器都能提供完全准确的温度读数，

sentences.en: pressure, humidity, and any other quantity a meteorologist would want.
sentences.native: 压力、湿度以及气象学家想要的任何其他量。

sentences.en: Precisely at noon an infinitely powerful computer takes all the data and calculates what will happen at each point
sentences.native: 就在中午，一台功能无限的计算机获取所有数据并计算每个点会发生什么

sentences.en: The computer will still be unable to predict whether Princeton, New Jersey, will have sun or rain on a day one month away.
sentences.native: 计算机仍然无法预测一个月后新泽西州普林斯顿的某一天是晴天还是下雨。

sentences.en: At noon the spaces between the sensors will hide fluctuations that the computer will not know about,
sentences.native: 中午，传感器之间的空间会隐藏计算机无法知道的波动，

sentences.en: tiny deviations from the average.
sentences.native: 与平均值的微小偏差。

sentences.en: By 12.01, those fluctuations will already have created small errors one foot away.
sentences.native: 到 12.01，这些波动已经在一英尺之外造成了小误差。

sentences.en: Soon the errors will have multiplied to the ten-foot scale, and so on up to the size of the globe.
sentences.native: 很快，误差就会扩大到十英尺的规模，依此类推，扩大到地球的大小。

sentences.en: Two factors weigh heavily against the effectiveness of scientific research in industry.
sentences.native: 有两个因素严重影响工业科学研究的有效性。

sentences.en: One is the general atmosphere of secrecy in which it is carried out,
sentences.native: 一是整个过程的保密气氛，

sentences.en: the other the lack of freedom of the individual research worker.
sentences.native: 另一个是研究人员个人缺乏自由。

sentences.en: In so far as any inquiry is a secret one,
sentences.native: 就任何调查而言，都是秘密的

sentences.en: it naturally limits all those engaged in carrying it out from effective contact with their fellow scientists either in other countries or in universities,
sentences.native: 它自然限制了所有从事这项工作的人与其他国家或大学的科学家同行的有效接触，

sentences.en: or even, often enough, in other departments of the same firm.
sentences.native: 甚至，通常是在同一家公司的其他部门。

sentences.en: The degree of secrecy naturally varies considerably.
sentences.native: 保密程度自然差异很大。

sentences.en: Some of the bigger firms are engaged in researches which are of such general and fundamental nature
sentences.native: 一些较大的公司正在从事具有普遍性和基础性的研究

sentences.en: that it is a positive advantage to them not to keep them secret.
sentences.native: 不保守秘密对他们来说是一个积极的优势。

sentences.en: Yet a great many processes depending on such research are sought for with complete secrecy until the stage at which patents can be taken out.
sentences.native: 然而，许多依赖于此类研究的过程都是在完全保密的情况下进行的，直到可以申请专利的阶段为止。

sentences.en: Even more processes are never patented at all but kept as secret processes.
sentences.native: 更多的工艺根本没有申请专利，而是作为秘密工艺保存。

sentences.en: This applies particularly to chemical industries,
sentences.native: 这尤其适用于化学工业，

sentences.en: where chance discoveries play a much larger part than they do in physical and mechanical industries.
sentences.native: 偶然发现比物理和机械工业发挥更大的作用。

sentences.en: Sometimes the secrecy goes to such an extent that the whole nature of the research cannot be mentioned.
sentences.native: 有时，保密程度达到了无法提及研究的全部性质的程度。

sentences.en: Many firms, for instance have great difficulty in obtaining technical or scientific books from libraries
sentences.native: 例如，许多公司很难从图书馆获取技术或科学书籍

sentences.en: because they are unwilling to have their names entered as having taken out such and such a book,
sentences.native: 因为他们不愿意把自己的名字录入，因为他们拿出了某某书，

sentences.en: for fear the agents of other firms should be able to trace the kind of research they are likely to be undertaking.
sentences.native: 因为担心其他公司的代理人应该能够追踪他们可能正在进行的研究类型。

sentences.en: In the organization of industrial life the influence of the factory upon the physiological and mental state of the workers has been completely neglected.
sentences.native: 在工业生活的组织中，工厂对工人生理和心理状态的影响被完全忽视了。

sentences.en: Modern industry is based on the conception of the maximum production at lowest cost,
sentences.native: 现代工业基于以最低成本获得最大产量的理念，

sentences.en: in order that an individual or a group of individuals may earn as much money as possible.
sentences.native: 以便个人或一群人可以赚到尽可能多的钱。

sentences.en: It has expanded without any idea of the true nature of the human beings who run the machines,
sentences.native: 它的扩张完全不了解操作机器的人类的真实本质，

sentences.en: and without giving any consideration to the effects produced on the individuals and on their descendants by the artificial mode of existence imposed by the factory.
sentences.native: 没有考虑工厂强加的人为生存模式对个人及其后代产生的影响。

sentences.en: The great cities have been built with no regard for us.
sentences.native: 大城市的建造并没有考虑到我们。

sentences.en: The shape and dimensions of the skyscrapers depend entirely on the necessity of obtaining the maximum income per square foot of ground,
sentences.native: 摩天大楼的形状和尺寸完全取决于获得每平方英尺土地最大收入的必要性，

sentences.en: and of offering to the tenants offices and apartments that please them.
sentences.native: 并向租户提供令他们满意的办公室和公寓。

sentences.en: This caused the construction of gigantic buildings where too large masses of human beings are crowded together.
sentences.native: 这导致了巨大的建筑物的建造，太多的人挤在一起。

sentences.en: Civilized men like such a way of living.
sentences.native: 文明人喜欢这样的生活方式。

sentences.en: While they enjoy the comfort and banal luxury of their dwelling, they do not realize that they are deprived of the necessities of life.
sentences.native: 当他们享受住所的舒适和平庸的奢华时，他们没有意识到他们被剥夺了生活必需品。

sentences.en: The modern city consists of monstrous edifices and of dark, narrow streets full of petrol fumes and toxic gases,
sentences.native: 现代城市由巨大的大厦和充满汽油味和有毒气体的黑暗狭窄的街道组成，

sentences.en: torn by the noise of the taxicabs, lorries and buses, and thronged ceaselessly by great crowds.
sentences.native: 出租车、卡车和公共汽车的噪音撕裂了这里，人群不断拥挤。

sentences.en: Obviously, it has not been planned for the good of its inhabitants.
sentences.native: 显然，它并不是为了居民的利益而规划的。

sentences.en: In the early days of the settlement of Australia, enterprising settlers unwisely introduced the European rabbit.
sentences.native: 在澳大利亚定居初期，有进取心的定居者不明智地引入了欧洲兔。

sentences.en: This rabbit had no natural enemies in the Antipodes, so that it multiplied with that promiscuous abandon characteristic of rabbits.
sentences.native: 这种兔子在对足动物中没有天敌，因此它以兔子的混杂抛弃特性繁殖。

sentences.en: It overran a whole continent.
sentences.native: 它覆盖了整个大陆。

sentences.en: It caused devastation by burrowing and by devouring the herbage which might have maintained millions of sheep and cattle.
sentences.native: 它通过挖洞和吞噬原本可以养活数百万只羊和牛的牧草而造成破坏。

sentences.en: Scientists discovered that this particular variety of rabbit (and apparently no other animal) was susceptible to a fatal virus disease, myxomatosis.
sentences.native: 科学家发现，这种特殊品种的兔子（显然没有其他动物）容易感染致命的病毒性疾病——粘液瘤病。

sentences.en: By infecting animals and letting them loose in the burrows, local epidemics of this disease could be created.
sentences.native: 通过感染动物并将它们释放到洞穴中，可能会造成这种疾病的局部流行。

sentences.en: Later it was found that there was a type of mosquito which acted as the carrier of this disease and passed it on to the rabbits.
sentences.native: 后来发现有一种蚊子是这种疾病的携带者，并将其传染给兔子。

sentences.en: So while the rest of the world was trying to get rid of mosquitoes, Australia was encouraging this one.
sentences.native: 因此，当世界其他国家都在努力消灭蚊子时，澳大利亚却在鼓励这种蚊子。

sentences.en: It effectively spread the disease all over the continent and drastically reduced the rabit population.
sentences.native: 它有效地将疾病传播到整个大陆，并大幅减少了兔子的数量。

sentences.en: It later became apparent that rabbits were developing a degree of resistance to this disease,
sentences.native: 后来发现兔子对这种疾病产生了一定程度的抵抗力，

sentences.en: so that the rabbit population was unlikely to be completely exterminated.
sentences.native: 因此兔子种群不太可能被完全消灭。

sentences.en: There were hopes, however, that the problem of the rabbit would become manageable.
sentences.native: 然而，人们希望兔子的问题能够得到解决。

sentences.en: Ironically, Europe, which had bequeathed the rabbit as a pest to Australia, acquired this man-made disease as a pestilence.
sentences.native: 具有讽刺意味的是，欧洲将兔子作为害虫遗赠给了澳大利亚，却将这种人造疾病作为瘟疫传染给了澳大利亚。

sentences.en: A French physician decided to get rid of the wild rabbits on his own estate and introduced myxomatosis.
sentences.native: 一位法国医生决定消灭他自己庄园里的野兔，并引入了粘液瘤病。

sentences.en: It did not, however, remain within the confines of this estate.
sentences.native: 然而，它并没有留在这个庄园的范围内。

sentences.en: It spread through France, where wild rabbits are not generally regarded as a pest but as a sport and a useful food supply,
sentences.native: 它传播到法国，在那里野兔通常不被视为害虫，而是一种运动和有用的食物供应，

sentences.en: and it spread to Britain where wild rabbits are regarded as a pest but where domesticated rabbits,
sentences.native: 它传播到了英国，那里的野兔被视为害虫，但那里的家兔，

sentences.en: equally susceptible to the disease, are the basis of a profitable fur industry.
sentences.native: 同样容易受到这种疾病的影响，是毛皮工业盈利的基础。

sentences.en: The question became one of whether Man could control the disease he had invented.
sentences.native: 问题之一是人类能否控制他发明的疾病。

sentences.en: There has long been a superstition among mariners that porpoises will save drowning men by pushing them to the surface,
sentences.native: 水手们长期以来一直迷信，认为海豚会将溺水者推到水面来拯救他们，

sentences.en: or protect them from sharks by surrounding them in defensive formation.
sentences.native: 或者通过将它们包围成防御阵型来保护它们免受鲨鱼的侵害。

sentences.en: Marine Studio biologists have pointed out that, however intelligent they may be,
sentences.native: 海洋工作室的生物学家指出，无论它们有多聪明，

sentences.en: it is probably a mistake to credit dolphins with any motive of life-saving.
sentences.native: 认为海豚具有拯救生命的动机可能是错误的。

sentences.en: On the occasions when they have pushed to shore an unconscious human being they have much more likely done it out of curiosity or for sport,
sentences.native: 当他们把一个失去知觉的人推上岸时，他们更有可能是出于好奇或为了好玩，

sentences.en: as in riding the bow waves of a ship.
sentences.native: 就像乘着船头的波浪一样。

sentences.en: In 1928 some porpoises were photographed working like beavers to push ashore a waterlogged mattress.
sentences.native: 1928 年，一些海豚被拍到像海狸一样将浸水的床垫推上岸。

sentences.en: If, as has been reported, they have protected humans from sharks,
sentences.native: 如果像报道的那样，它们保护了人类免受鲨鱼的侵害，

sentences.en: it may have been because curiosity attracted them and because the scent of a possible meal attracted the sharks.
sentences.native: 可能是因为好奇心吸引了它们，也可能是因为可能的食物的气味吸引了鲨鱼。

sentences.en: Porpoises and sharks are natural enemies.
sentences.native: 海豚和鲨鱼是天敌。

sentences.en: It is possible that upon such an occasion a battle ensued, with the sharks being driven away or killed.
sentences.native: 在这种情况下，可能会发生一场战斗，鲨鱼被赶走或杀死。

sentences.en: Whether it be bird, fish or beast, the porpoise is intrigued with anything that is alive.
sentences.native: 无论是鸟、鱼还是野兽，海豚对任何有生命的东西都感兴趣。

sentences.en: They are constantly after the turtles, who peacefully submit to all sorts of indignities.
sentences.native: 他们不断地追捕海龟，而海龟却平静地接受了各种侮辱。

sentences.en: One young calf especially enjoyed raising a turtle to the surface with his snout,
sentences.native: 一只小牛特别喜欢用鼻子把海龟举到水面，

sentences.en: and then shoving him across the tank like an aquaplane.
sentences.native: 然后像滑水机一样把他推过坦克。

sentences.en: Almost any day a young porpoises may be seen trying to turn a 300-pound sea turtle over by sticking his snout under the edge of his shell and pushing up for dear life.
sentences.native: 几乎每天，人们都会看到一只年幼的江豚试图将一只 300 磅重的海龟翻过来，将鼻子伸到海龟壳的边缘下，然后奋力向上推，以求保命。

sentences.en: This is not easy, and may require two porpoises working together.
sentences.native: 这并不容易，可能需要两只海豚一起工作。

sentences.en: In another game, as the turtle swims across the oceanarium, the first porpoise swoops down from above and butts his shell with his belly.
sentences.native: 在另一场游戏中，当海龟游过海洋馆时，第一只鼠海豚从上方俯冲下来，用腹部抵住龟壳。

sentences.en: This knocks the turtle down several feet.
sentences.native: 这会将乌龟击落几英尺。

sentences.en: He no sooner recovers his equilibrium than the next porpoises comes along and hits him another crack.
sentences.native: 他刚恢复平衡，下一只海豚就出现了，再次袭击了他。

sentences.en: Eventually the turtle has been butted all the way down to the floor of the tank.
sentences.native: 最终，乌龟被一路撞到了水箱的地板上。

sentences.en: He is now satisfied merely to try to stand up, but as soon as he does so a porpoise knocks him flat.
sentences.native: 现在他只要试着站起来就心满意足了，但当他站起来时，一只海豚把他撞倒了。

sentences.en: The turtle at last gives up by pulling his feet under his shell and the game is over.
sentences.native: 乌龟最终放弃了，把脚拉到龟壳里，游戏结束了。

sentences.en: It is fairly clear that the sleeping period must have some function, and because there is so much of it the function would seem to be important.
sentences.native: 很明显，睡眠期一定有某种功能，而且由于睡眠时间如此之多，所以这种功能似乎很重要。

sentences.en: Speculations about its nature have been going on for literally thousands of years,
sentences.native: 关于它的本质的猜测已经持续了数千年，

sentences.en: and one odd finding that makes the problem puzzling is that it looks very much as if sleeping is not simply a matter of giving the body a rest.
sentences.native: 一个让这个问题令人费解的奇怪发现是，睡眠似乎不仅仅是让身体休息的问题。

sentences.en: 'Rest', in terms of muscle relaxation and so on, can be achieved by a brief period lying, or even sitting down.
sentences.native: “休息”，即肌肉放松等，可以通过短暂的躺卧甚至坐下来实现。

sentences.en: The body's tissues are self-repairing and self-restoring to a degree, and function best when more or less continuously active.
sentences.native: 身体的组织在一定程度上具有自我修复和自我恢复的能力，当或多或少持续活跃时，其功能最佳。

sentences.en: In fact a basic amount of movement occurs during sleep which is specifically concerned with preventing muscle inactivity.
sentences.native: 事实上，睡眠期间会发生基本的运动量，这特别与防止肌肉不活动有关。

sentences.en: If it is not a question of resting the body, then perhaps it is the brain that needs resting?
sentences.native: 如果不是身体需要休息的问题，那么或许是大脑需要休息呢？

sentences.en: This might be a plausible hypothesis were it not for two factors.
sentences.native: 如果没有两个因素的话，这可能是一个合理的假设。

sentences.en: First the electroencephalograph (which is simply a device for recording the electrical activity of the brain by attaching electrodes to the scalp)
sentences.native: 首先是脑电图仪（它只是一种通过将电极连接到头皮来记录大脑电活动的设备）

sentences.en: shows that while there is a change in the pattern of activity during sleep,
sentences.native: 表明虽然睡眠期间的活动模式发生了变化，

sentences.en: there is no evidence that the total amount of activity is any less.
sentences.native: 没有证据表明活动总量有所减少。

sentences.en: The second factor is more interesting and more fundamental.
sentences.native: 第二个因素更有趣，也更基本。

sentences.en: Some years ago an American psychiatrist named William Dement published experiments dealing with the recording of eye-movements during sleep.
sentences.native: 几年前，一位名叫威廉·德门特的美国精神病学家发表了记录睡眠期间眼球运动的实验。

sentences.en: He showed that the average individual's sleep cycle is punctuated with peculiar bursts of eye-movements, some drifting and slow, others jerky and rapid.
sentences.native: 他表明，普通人的睡眠周期会不时出现特殊的眼球运动，有些是漂移且缓慢的，另一些是不稳定且快速的。

sentences.en: People woken during these periods of eye-movements generally reported that they had been dreaming.
sentences.native: 在这些眼球运动期间醒来的人通常报告说他们一直在做梦。

sentences.en: When woken at other times they reported no dreams.
sentences.native: 当其他时间醒来时，他们报告说没有做梦。

sentences.en: If one group of people were disturbed from their eye-movement sleep for several nights on end,
sentences.native: 如果一组人的眼动睡眠连续几个晚上受到干扰，

sentences.en: and another group were disturbed for an equal period of time but when they were not exhibiting eye-movements,
sentences.native: 另一组在相同的时间内受到干扰，但当他们没有表现出眼球运动时，

sentences.en: the first group began to show some personality disorders while the others seemed more or less unaffected.
sentences.native: 第一组开始表现出一些人格障碍，而其他组似乎或多或少没有受到影响。

sentences.en: The implications of all this were that it was not the disturbance of sleep that mattered, but the disturbance of dreaming.
sentences.native: 所有这一切的含义是，重要的不是睡眠的干扰，而是梦的干扰。

sentences.en: How in came about that snakes manufactured poison is a mystery.
sentences.native: 蛇是如何产生毒液的还是一个谜。

sentences.en: Over the periods their saliva, a mild, digestive juice like our own, was converted into a poison that defies analysis even today.
sentences.native: 在这段时期内，它们的唾液，一种像我们一样温和的消化液，被转化为一种即使在今天也无法分析的毒药。

sentences.en: It was not forced upon them by the survival competition;
sentences.native: 这并不是生存竞争强加给他们的；而是他们被迫接受的。

sentences.en: they could have caught and lived on prey without using poison, just as the thousands of non-poisonous snakes still do.
sentences.native: 它们可以不使用毒药来捕捉猎物并以此为生，就像成千上万的无毒蛇仍然这样做一样。

sentences.en: Poison to a snake is merely a luxury;
sentences.native: 对蛇来说，毒药只是一种奢侈；

sentences.en: it enables it to get its food with very little effort, no more effort than one bite.
sentences.native: 它使它能够毫不费力地获取食物，只需咬一口即可。

sentences.en: And why only snakes?
sentences.native: 为什么只有蛇？

sentences.en: Cats, for instance, would be greatly helped;
sentences.native: 例如，猫会得到很大的帮助。

sentences.en: no running fights with large, fierce rats or tussles with grown rabbits--just a bite and no more effort needed.
sentences.native: 不需要与凶猛的大老鼠打架，也不需要与成年兔子打架——只需咬一口，不需要更多的努力。

sentences.en: In fact, it would be an assistance to all carnivores though it would be a two-edged weapon when they fought each other.
sentences.native: 事实上，它对所有食肉动物来说都是一种帮助，尽管在它们互相争斗时它是一把两刃武器。

sentences.en: But, of the vertebrates unpredictable Nature selected only snakes (and one lizard).
sentences.native: 但是，在不可预测的脊椎动物中，大自然只选择了蛇（和一只蜥蜴）。

sentences.en: One wonders also why Nature, with some snakes concocted poison of such extreme potency.
sentences.native: 人们还想知道为什么大自然和一些蛇会配制出如此强大的毒药。

sentences.en: In the conversion of saliva into poison, one might suppose that a fixed process took place. It did not;
sentences.native: 在唾液转化为毒物的过程中，人们可能会认为发生了一个固定的过程。但事实并非如此；

sentences.en: some snakes manufactured a poison different in every respect from that of others,
sentences.native: 有些蛇制造的毒液在各方面都与其他蛇不同，

sentences.en: as different as arsenic is from strychnine, and having different effects.
sentences.native: 就像砷与马钱子碱一样不同，并且具有不同的作用。

sentences.en: One poison acts on the nerves, the other on the blood.
sentences.native: 一种毒物作用于神经，另一种毒物作用于血液。

sentences.en: The makers of the nerve poison include the mambas and the cobras and their venom is called neurotoxic.
sentences.native: 神经毒的制造者包括曼巴蛇和眼镜蛇，它们的毒液被称为神经毒。

sentences.en: Vipers (adders) and rattlesnakes manufacture the blood poison, which is known as haemolytic.
sentences.native: 蝰蛇和响尾蛇会产生血液毒物，称为溶血性毒物。

sentences.en: Both poisons are unpleasant, but by far the more unpleasant is the blood poison.
sentences.native: 这两种毒都令人不快，但迄今为止更令人不快的是血毒。

sentences.en: It is said that the nerve poison is the more primitive of the two, that the blood poison is, so to speak, a newer product from an improved formula.
sentences.native: 据说，神经毒剂是两者中更为原始的一种，而血液毒剂可以说是改进配方的新产品。

sentences.en: Be that as it may, the nerve poison does its business with man far more quickly than the blood poison.
sentences.native: 不管怎样，神经毒对人的作用比血液毒要快得多。

sentences.en: This, however, means nothing.
sentences.native: 然而，这没有任何意义。

sentences.en: Snakes did not acquire their poison for use against man but for use against prey such as rats and mice,
sentences.native: 蛇获得毒液并不是为了对付人类，而是为了对付老鼠等猎物。

sentences.en: and the effects on these of viperine poison is almost immediate.
sentences.native: 毒蛇毒对这些人的影响几乎是立竿见影的。

lessons.title: William S. Hart and the Early "Western" Film
lessons.mp3file: 21－William S. Hart and the Early Western Film.MP3

sentences.en: William S.Hart was, perhaps, the greatest of all Western stars,
sentences.native: 威廉·S·哈特也许是所有西方明星中最伟大的，

sentences.en: for unlike Gary Cooper and John Wayne he appeared in nothing but Westerns.
sentences.native: 因为与加里·库珀和约翰·韦恩不同，他只出现在西部片中。

sentences.en: From 1914 to 1924 he was supreme and unchallenged.
sentences.native: 从1914年到1924年，他处于至高无上的地位，无人能挑战。

sentences.en: It was Hart who created the basic formula of the Western film,
sentences.native: 是哈特创造了西部片的基本公式，

sentences.en: and devised the protagonist he played in every film he made,
sentences.native: 并设计了他在每部电影中扮演的主角，

sentences.en: the good-bad man, the accidental, noble outlaw,
sentences.native: 好人坏人，偶然的，高贵的亡命之徒，

sentences.en: or the honest, but framed cowboy, or the sheriff made suspect by vicious gossip;
sentences.native: 或者是诚实但被陷害的牛仔，或者是因恶意八卦而受到怀疑的警长；

sentences.en: in short, the individual in conflict with himself and his frontier environment.
sentences.native: 简而言之，个人与自己及其前沿环境发生冲突。

sentences.en: Unlike most of his contemporaries in Hollywood,
sentences.native: 与好莱坞的大多数同时代人不同，

sentences.en: Hart actually knew something of the old West.
sentences.native: 哈特实际上对旧西部有所了解。

sentences.en: He had lived in it as a child when it was already disappearing,
sentences.native: 当它已经消失时，他小时候就住在里面，

sentences.en: and his hero was firmly rooted in his memories and experiences,
sentences.native: 他的英雄深深植根于他的记忆和经历中，

sentences.en: and in both the history and the mythology of the vanished frontier,
sentences.native: 在消失的边疆的历史和神话中，

sentences.en: And although no period or place in American history has been more absurdly romanticized,
sentences.native: 尽管美国历史上没有哪个时期或地方比这更荒谬地浪漫化了，

sentences.en: myth and reality did join hands in at least one arena,
sentences.native: 神话和现实至少在一个舞台上携手共进，

sentences.en: the conflict between the individual and encroaching civilization.
sentences.native: 个人与入侵文明之间的冲突。

sentences.en: Men accustomed to struggling for survival against the elements and Indians
sentences.native: 习惯于与自然和印第安人抗争生存的男人

sentences.en: were bewildered by politicians, bankers and businessmen,
sentences.native: 政客、银行家和商人都感到困惑，

sentences.en: and unhorsed by fences, laws and alien taboos.
sentences.native: 并不受栅栏、法律和外来禁忌的束缚。

sentences.en: Hart's good-bad man was always an outsider, always one of the disinherited,
sentences.native: 哈特笔下的好人和坏人总是一个局外人，总是一个被剥夺继承权的人，

sentences.en: and if he found it necessary to shoot a sheriff or rob a bank along the way,
sentences.native: 如果他发现有必要在途中射杀治安官或抢劫银行，

sentences.en: his early audiences found it easy to understand and forgive,
sentences.native: 他的早期观众发现它很容易理解和原谅，

sentences.en: especially when it was Hart who, in the end, overcame the attacking Indians.
sentences.native: 尤其是当哈特最终战胜了进攻的印第安人时。

sentences.en: Audiences in the second decade of the twentieth century
sentences.native: 二十世纪第二个十年的观众

sentences.en: found it pleasant to escape to a time when life, though hard, was relatively simple.
sentences.native: 发现逃离到生活虽然艰难但相对简单的时代是件愉快的事。

sentences.en: We still do; living in a world in which undeclared aggression, war, hypocrisy,
sentences.native: 我们仍然这样做；生活在一个充满不公开的侵略、战争、虚伪、

sentences.en: chicanery, anarchy and impending immolation are part of our daily lives,
sentences.native: 欺骗、无政府状态和即将发生的自焚是我们日常生活的一部分，

sentences.en: we all want a code to live by.
sentences.native: 我们都想要一个赖以生存的准则。

sentences.en: Why does the idea of progress loom so large in the modern world?
sentences.native: 为什么进步的理念在现代世界如此重要？

sentences.en: Surely because progress of a particular kind is actually taking place around us
sentences.native: 肯定是因为某种特定的进步实际上正在我们周围发生

sentences.en: and is becoming more and more manifest.
sentences.native: 并且越来越明显。

sentences.en: Although mankind has undergone no general improvement in intelligence or morality,
sentences.native: 尽管人类的智力和道德并没有得到普遍的提高，

sentences.en: it has made extraordinary progress in the accumulation of knowledge.
sentences.native: 它在知识积累方面取得了非凡的进步。

sentences.en: Knowledge began to increase as soon as the thoughts of one individual
sentences.native: 一个人的思想一产生，知识就开始增长

sentences.en: could be communicated to another by means of speech.
sentences.native: 可以通过言语的方式传达给另一个人。

sentences.en: With the invention of writing, a great advance was made,
sentences.native: 随着文字的发明，取得了巨大的进步，

sentences.en: for knowledge could then be not only communicated but also stored.
sentences.native: 因为知识不仅可以交流，还可以存储。

sentences.en: Libraries made education possible, and education in its turn added to libraries:
sentences.native: 图书馆使教育成为可能，而教育又为图书馆增添了色彩：

sentences.en: the growth of knowledge followed a kind of compound interest law,
sentences.native: 知识的增长遵循一种复利法则，

sentences.en: which was greatly enhanced by the invention of printing.
sentences.native: 印刷术的发明大大增强了这一点。

sentences.en: All this was comparatively slow until, with the coming of science,
sentences.native: 所有这一切都相对缓慢，直到随着科学的到来，

sentences.en: the tempo was suddenly raised.
sentences.native: 节奏突然加快了。

sentences.en: Then knowledge began to be accumulated according to a systematic plan.
sentences.native: 然后知识开始按照系统的计划积累。

sentences.en: The trickle became a stream: the stream has now become a torrent.
sentences.native: 细流变成了溪流：溪流现在变成了激流。

sentences.en: Moreover, as soon as new knowledge is acquired, it is now turned to practical account.
sentences.native: 此外，一旦获得新知识，它就会立即转化为实际用途。

sentences.en: What is called 'modern civilization'
sentences.native: 什么叫“现代文明”

sentences.en: is not the result of a balanced development of all man's nature,
sentences.native: 不是所有人性均衡发展的结果，

sentences.en: but of accumulated knowledge applied to practical life.
sentences.native: 而是将积累的知识应用于实际生活。

sentences.en: The problem now facing humanity is:
sentences.native: 人类现在面临的问题是：

sentences.en: What is going to be done with all this knowledge?
sentences.native: 有了这些知识，我们可以做什么呢？

sentences.en: As is so often pointed out, knowledge is a two-edged weapon
sentences.native: 正如人们经常指出的那样，知识是一把双刃武器

sentences.en: which can be used equally for good or evil.
sentences.native: 它可以同样用于善行或邪恶。

sentences.en: It is now being used indifferently for both.
sentences.native: 现在它对两者都被漠不关心地使用。

sentences.en: Could any spectacle, for instance, be more grimly whimsical
sentences.native: 例如，还有什么奇观比这更残酷、异想天开吗？

sentences.en: than that of gunners using science to shatter men's bodies
sentences.native: 比枪手用科学粉碎男人的身体

sentences.en: while, close at hand, surgeons use it to restore them?
sentences.native: 而外科医生就在附近用它来修复它们？

sentences.en: We have to ask ourselves very seriously
sentences.native: 我们必须非常认真地问自己

sentences.en: what will happen if this twofold use of knowledge,
sentences.native: 如果这种知识的双重使用会发生什么，

sentences.en: with its ever-increasing power, continues.
sentences.native: 以其不断增强的力量，继续。

sentences.en: No two sorts of birds practise quite the same sort of flight;
sentences.native: 没有两种鸟具有完全相同的飞行方式。

sentences.en: the varieties are infinite; but two classes may be roughly seen.
sentences.native: 品种是无限的；但大致可以看出两类。

sentences.en: Any ship that crosses the Pacific
sentences.native: 任何横渡太平洋的船只

sentences.en: is accompanied for many days by the smaller albatross,
sentences.native: 较小的信天翁陪伴了很多天，

sentences.en: which may keep company with the vessel for an hour
sentences.native: 可以与船只陪伴一个小时

sentences.en: without visible or more than occasional movement of wing.
sentences.native: 机翼没有明显的运动或超过偶尔的运动。

sentences.en: The currents of air that the walls of the ship direct upwards,
sentences.native: 船壁向上的气流，

sentences.en: as well as in the line of its course,
sentences.native: 以及它的路线，

sentences.en: are enough to give the great bird with its immense wings
sentences.native: 足以赋予那只拥有巨大翅膀的大鸟

sentences.en: sufficient sustenance and progress.
sentences.native: 足够的寄托和进步。

sentences.en: The albatross is the king of the gliders,
sentences.native: 信天翁是滑翔机之王，

sentences.en: the class of fliers which harness the air to their purpose,
sentences.native: 利用空气达到其目的的飞行者类别，

sentences.en: but must yield to its opposition.
sentences.native: 但必须屈服于其反对。

sentences.en: In the contrary school, the duck is supreme.
sentences.native: 在相反的学校里，鸭子是至高无上的。

sentences.en: It comes nearer to the engines with which man has 'conquered' the air, as he boasts.
sentences.native: 正如他所吹嘘的那样，它更接近于人类“征服”空气的引擎。

sentences.en: Duck, and like them the pigeons, are endowed with steel-like muscles,
sentences.native: 鸭子和鸽子一样，都拥有钢铁般的肌肉，

sentences.en: that are a good part of the weight of the bird,
sentences.native: 这是鸟的重量的很大一部分，

sentences.en: and these will ply the short wings with such irresistible power
sentences.native: 这些将使短翅膀具有不可抗拒的力量

sentences.en: that they can bore for long distances through an opposing gale
sentences.native: 他们可以在逆风中长距离行驶

sentences.en: before exhaustion follows.
sentences.native: 在精疲力尽之前。

sentences.en: Their humbler followers, such as partridges,
sentences.native: 他们的卑微追随者，如鹧鸪，

sentences.en: have a like power of strong propulsion, but soon tire.
sentences.native: 有一种类似力量的强大推进力，但很快就会疲倦。

sentences.en: You may pick them up in utter exhaustion,
sentences.native: 你可能会在极度疲惫的情况下拿起它们，

sentences.en: if wind over the sea has driven them to a long journey.
sentences.native: 如果海上的风驱使他们长途跋涉。

sentences.en: The swallow shares the virtues of both schools in highest measure.
sentences.native: 燕子在很大程度上分享了两所学校的优点。

sentences.en: It tires not, nor does it boast of its power; but belongs to the air
sentences.native: 它不疲倦，也不夸耀自己的力量；却属于空气

sentences.en: travelling it may be six thousand miles to and from its northern nesting home,
sentences.native: 它往返其北部巢穴的路程可能有六千英里，

sentences.en: feeding its flown young as it flies, and slipping through a medium
sentences.native: 当它飞翔时喂养它飞翔的幼崽，并滑过介质

sentences.en: that seems to help its passage even when the wind is adverse.
sentences.native: 即使在逆风的情况下，这似乎也有助于其通过。

sentences.en: Such birds do us good,
sentences.native: 这样的鸟对我们有好处，

sentences.en: though we no longer take omens from their flight on this side and that;
sentences.native: 尽管我们不再从他们的这边或那边逃跑中得到预兆；

sentences.en: and even the most superstitious villagers no longer take off their hats to the magpie and wish it good-morning.
sentences.native: 即使是最迷信的村民也不再向喜鹊脱帽祝晚安。

sentences.en: A young man sees a sunset and,
sentences.native: 一个年轻人看到日落，

sentences.en: unable to understand or to express the emotion that it rouses in him,
sentences.native: 无法理解或表达它在他内心激起的情感，

sentences.en: concludes that it must be the gateway to a world that lies beyond
sentences.native: 结论是它一定是通往彼岸世界的大门

sentences.en: It is difficult for any of us in moments of intense aesthetic experience
sentences.native: 对于我们任何人来说，在强烈的审美体验时刻都是困难的

sentences.en: to resist the suggestion that we are catching a glimpse of a light
sentences.native: 抵制我们正在瞥见曙光的说法

sentences.en: that shines down to us from a different realm of existence, different and,
sentences.native: 它从不同的存在领域向我们发出光芒，不同的，

sentences.en: because the experience is intensely moving, in some way higher.
sentences.native: 因为这种体验非常令人感动，甚至在某种程度上更加令人感动。

sentences.en: And, though the gleams blind and dazzle, yet do they convey a hint of beauty and serenity
sentences.native: 尽管这些光芒令人眼花缭乱，但它们却传达出一丝美丽和宁静

sentences.en: greater than we have known or imagined. Greater too than we can describe;
sentences.native: 比我们所知或想象的要大。也比我们所能描述的还要伟大；

sentences.en: for language, which was invented to convey the meanings of this world
sentences.native: 对于语言来说，它是为了传达这个世界的意义而发明的

sentences.en: cannot readily be fitted to the uses of another.
sentences.native: 不能轻易地适应他人的用途。

sentences.en: That all great art has this power of suggesting a world beyond is undeniable.
sentences.native: 不可否认的是，所有伟大的艺术都具有暗示彼岸世界的力量。

sentences.en: In some moods, nature shares it.
sentences.native: 在某些情绪下，大自然也有同样的感受。

sentences.en: There is no sky in June so blue that it does not point forward to a bluer,
sentences.native: 六月的天空没有那么蓝，不指向更蓝，

sentences.en: no sunset so beautiful that it does not waken the vision of a greater beauty,
sentences.native: 没有哪一个日落如此美丽，以至于不能唤醒更美的愿景，

sentences.en: a vision which passes before it is fully glimpsed,
sentences.native: 在完全被瞥见之前就已经过去的幻象，

sentences.en: and in passing leaves an indefinable longing and regret.
sentences.native: 顺便留下了一种说不清的思念和遗憾。

sentences.en: But, if this world is not merely a bad joke,
sentences.native: 但是，如果这个世界不仅仅是一个糟糕的笑话，

sentences.en: life a vulgar flare amid the cool radiance of the stars,
sentences.native: 生命是星星冷光中庸俗的耀斑，

sentences.en: and existence an empty laugh braying across the mysteries;
sentences.native: 存在是空洞的笑声，穿过神秘的声音；

sentences.en: if these intimations of a something behind and beyond
sentences.native: 如果这些暗示背后有什么东西

sentences.en: are not evil humour born of indigestion,
sentences.native: 不是消化不良产生的邪恶幽默，

sentences.en: or whimsies sent by the devil to mock and madden us, if, in a word
sentences.native: 或者魔鬼发出的奇思妙想来嘲笑和激怒我们，如果，一句话

sentences.en: beauty means something yet we must not seek to interpret the meaning.
sentences.native: 美意味着某种东西，但我们不能试图解释其含义。

sentences.en: If we glimpse the unutterable, it is unwise to try to utter it,
sentences.native: 如果我们瞥见了无法言说的事情，试图说出它是不明智的，

sentences.en: nor should we seek to invest with significance that which we cannot grasp.
sentences.native: 我们也不应该寻求对我们无法掌握的事物进行重大投资。

sentences.en: Beauty in terms of our human meanings is meaningless.
sentences.native: 美对于我们人类的意义来说是毫无意义的。

sentences.en: Many people in industry and the Services,
sentences.native: 许多工业界和服务业人士，

sentences.en: who have practical experience of noise,
sentences.native: 有噪音实际经验的人，

sentences.en: regard any investigation of this question as a waste of time;
sentences.native: 认为对此问题的任何调查都是浪费时间；

sentences.en: they are not prepared even to admit the possibility that noise affects people.
sentences.native: 他们甚至不准备承认噪音影响人类的可能性。

sentences.en: On the other hand,
sentences.native: 另一方面，

sentences.en: those who dislike noise will sometimes use most inadequate evidence
sentences.native: 那些不喜欢噪音的人有时会使用最不充分的证据

sentences.en: to support their pleas for a quieter society.
sentences.native: 支持他们对一个更安静的社会的诉求。

sentences.en: This is a pity, because noise abatement really is a good cause,
sentences.native: 这很遗憾，因为降噪确实是一个很好的事业，

sentences.en: and it is likely to be discredited if it gets to be associated with bad science.
sentences.native: 如果它与糟糕的科学联系在一起，它可能会失去信誉。

sentences.en: One allegation often made is that noise produces mental illness.
sentences.native: 一项经常被提出的指控是噪音会导致精神疾病。

sentences.en: A recent article in a weekly newspaper, for instance,
sentences.native: 例如，最近一份周报上的一篇文章，

sentences.en: was headed with a striking illustration of a lady in a state of considerable distress,
sentences.native: 标题是一幅引人注目的插图，描绘了一位处于相当痛苦状态的女士，

sentences.en: with the caption 'She was yet another victim, reduced to a screaming wreck'.
sentences.native: 标题是“她是又一个受害者，沦为尖叫的残骸”。

sentences.en: On turning eagerly to the text, one learns that the lady was a typist
sentences.native: 当人们急切地翻阅文字时，发现这位女士是一名打字员

sentences.en: who found the sound of office typewriters worried her more and more
sentences.native: 谁发现办公室打字机的声音让她越来越担心

sentences.en: until eventually she had to go into a mental hospital.
sentences.native: 直到最后她不得不住进精神病院。

sentences.en: Now the snag in this sort of anecdote is of course that one cannot distinguish cause and effect.
sentences.native: 当然，这种轶事的问题在于人们无法区分因果关系。

sentences.en: Was the noise a cause of the illness,
sentences.native: 噪音是导致疾病的原因吗

sentences.en: or were the complaints about noise merely a symptom?
sentences.native: 或者对噪音的抱怨仅仅是一种症状？

sentences.en: Another patient might equally well complain
sentences.native: 另一位患者可能同样会抱怨

sentences.en: that her neighbours were combining to slander her and persecute her,
sentences.native: 她的邻居联合起来诽谤她、迫害她，

sentences.en: and yet one might be cautious about believing this statement.
sentences.native: 然而，人们可能对相信这一说法持谨慎态度。

sentences.en: What is needed in the case of noise is a study of large numbers of people living under noisy conditions,
sentences.native: 在噪音的情况下需要的是对大量生活在噪音条件下的人进行研究，

sentences.en: to discover whether they are mentally ill more often than other people are.
sentences.native: 发现他们是否比其他人更容易患精神疾病。

sentences.en: Some time ago the United States Navy, for instance,
sentences.native: 例如，不久前美国海军，

sentences.en: examined a very large number of men working on aircraft carriers:
sentences.native: 检查了大量在航空母舰上工作的人员：

sentences.en: the study was known as Project Anehin.
sentences.native: 这项研究被称为“Anehin 项目”。

sentences.en: It can be unpleasant to live even several miles from an aerodrome;
sentences.native: 即使住在距离机场几英里的地方也会让人感到不愉快；

sentences.en: if you think what it must be like to share the deck of a ship with several squadrons of jet aircraft,
sentences.native: 如果你想象与几个中队的喷气式飞机共享一艘船的甲板会是什么样子，

sentences.en: you will realize that a modern navy is a good place to study noise.
sentences.native: 你会意识到现代海军是研究噪音的好地方。

sentences.en: But neither psychiatric interviews nor objective tests
sentences.native: 但既没有精神病学访谈也没有客观测试

sentences.en: were able to show any effects upon these American sailors.
sentences.native: 能够对这些美国水手产生任何影响。

sentences.en: This result merely confirms earlier American and British studies:
sentences.native: 这一结果仅仅证实了早期美国和英国的研究：

sentences.en: if there is any effect of noise upon mental health,
sentences.native: 如果噪音对心理健康有任何影响，

sentences.en: it must be so small that present methods of psychiatric diagnosis cannot find it.
sentences.native: 它一定是如此之小，以至于现有的精神病学诊断方法无法找到它。

sentences.en: That does not prove that it does not exist; but it does mean
sentences.native: 这并不能证明它不存在；但这确实意味着

sentences.en: that noise is less dangerous than, say being brought up in an orphanage
sentences.native: 噪音比在孤儿院长大的危险要小

sentences.en: --which really is a mental health hazard.
sentences.native: ——这确实是一种心理健康危害。

lessons.title: The Past Life of the Earth

sentences.en: It is animals and plants which lived in or near water whose remains are most likely to be preserved,
sentences.native: 生活在水中或水附近的动物和植物的遗骸最有可能被保存下来，

sentences.en: for one of the necessary conditions of preservation is quick burial,
sentences.native: 因为保存的必要条件之一就是快速埋葬，

sentences.en: and it is only in the seas and rivers, and sometimes lakes,
sentences.native: 它只存在于海洋和河流中，有时也存在于湖泊中，

sentences.en: where mud and silt have been continuously deposited,
sentences.native: 泥土和淤泥不断沉积的地方，

sentences.en: that bodies and the like can be rapidly covered over and preserved.
sentences.native: 尸体等可以被迅速覆盖并保存。

sentences.en: But even in the most favourable circumstances
sentences.native: 但即使在最有利的情况下

sentences.en: only a small fraction of the creatures that die are preserved in this way
sentences.native: 只有一小部分死去的生物以这种方式得以保存

sentences.en: before decay sets in or, even more likely, before scavengers eat them.
sentences.native: 在腐烂之前，或者更有可能的是，在食腐动物吃掉它们之前。

sentences.en: After all, all living creatures live by feeding on something else,
sentences.native: 毕竟，所有生物都是靠吃其他东西来生存的，

sentences.en: whether it be plant or animal, dead or alive,
sentences.native: 无论是植物还是动物，是死的还是活的，

sentences.en: and it is only by chance that such a fate is avoided.
sentences.native: 避免这样的命运纯属偶然。

sentences.en: The remains of plants and animals that lived on land are much more rarely preserved,
sentences.native: 生活在陆地上的植物和动物的遗骸很少得到保存，

sentences.en: for there is seldom anything to cover them over.
sentences.native: 因为很少有什么东西可以遮盖它们。

sentences.en: When you think of the innumerable birds that one sees flying about,
sentences.native: 当你想到无数飞翔的鸟儿时，

sentences.en: not to mention the equally numerous small animals like field mice and voles which you do not see,
sentences.native: 更不用说同样数量众多的田鼠、田鼠等你看不到的小动物了，

sentences.en: it is very rarely that one comes across a dead body, except, of course, on the roads.
sentences.native: 人们很少会遇到尸体，当然，除了在路上。

sentences.en: They decompose and are quickly destroyed by the weather or eaten by some other creature.
sentences.native: 它们会分解并很快被天气破坏或被其他生物吃掉。

sentences.en: It is almost always due to some very special circumstances that traces of land animals survive,
sentences.native: 陆地动物的痕迹几乎总是由于一些非常特殊的环境而得以生存，

sentences.en: as by falling into inaccessible caves, or into an ice crevasse,
sentences.native: 例如掉入难以进入的洞穴或冰裂缝中，

sentences.en: like the Siberian mammoths,
sentences.native: 就像西伯利亚猛犸象一样，

sentences.en: when the whole animal is sometimes preserved, as in a refrigerator.
sentences.native: 有时会保存整个动物，例如放在冰箱中。

sentences.en: This is what happened to the famous Beresovka mammoth which was found preserved and in good condition.
sentences.native: 这就是著名的别列索夫卡猛犸象的遭遇，它被发现保存完好且状况良好。

sentences.en: In his mouth were the remains of fir trees--the last meal that he had before he fell into the crevasse and broke his back.
sentences.native: 他嘴里含着冷杉树的残骸——这是他掉进裂缝、折断背部之前吃的最后一顿饭。

sentences.en: The mammoth has now been restored in the Palaeontological Museum in St.Petersburg.
sentences.native: 这头猛犸象现已在圣彼得堡古生物学博物馆中修复。

sentences.en: Other animals were trapped in tar pits, like the elephants, sabre-toothed cats,
sentences.native: 其他动物也被困在焦油坑里，比如大象、剑齿虎、

sentences.en: and numerous other creatures that are found at Rancho la Brea, which is now just a suburb of Los Angeles.
sentences.native: 以及在兰乔拉布雷亚发现的许多其他生物，兰乔拉布雷亚现在只是洛杉矶的郊区。

sentences.en: Apparently what happened was that water collected on these tar pits
sentences.native: 显然发生的事情是这些焦油坑上聚集了水

sentences.en: and the bigger animals like the elephants ventured out on to the apparently firm surface to drink,
sentences.native: 像大象这样的大型动物冒险到明显坚硬的表面喝水，

sentences.en: and were promptly bogged in the tar.
sentences.native: 并立即陷入焦油之中。

sentences.en: And then, when they were dead, the carnivores,
sentences.native: 然后，当它们死后，食肉动物，

sentences.en: like the sabretoothed cats and the giant wolves,
sentences.native: 就像剑齿虎和巨狼一样，

sentences.en: came out to feed and suffered exactly the same fate.
sentences.native: 出来觅食，遭遇了完全相同的命运。

sentences.en: There are also endless numbers of birds in the tar as well.
sentences.native: 焦油里也有无数的鸟类。

sentences.en: From the seventeenth-century empire of Sweden,
sentences.native: 来自十七世纪的瑞典帝国，

sentences.en: the story of a galleon that sank at the start of her maiden voyage in 1628 must be one of the strangest tales of the sea.
sentences.native: 1628 年，一艘大帆船在她的处女航开始时沉没的故事一定是海上最奇怪的故事之一。

sentences.en: For nearly three and a half centuries she lay at the bottom of Stockholm harbour until her discovery in 1956.
sentences.native: 她在斯德哥尔摩港的海底沉睡了近三个半世纪，直到 1956 年被发现。

sentences.en: This was the Vasa, royal flagship of the great imperial fleet.
sentences.native: 这是瓦萨号，伟大帝国舰队的皇家旗舰。

sentences.en: King Gustavus Adolphus 'The Northern Hurricane',
sentences.native: 古斯塔夫·阿道夫国王“北方飓风”，

sentences.en: then at the height of his military success in the 'Thirty Years' War,
sentences.native: 然后在他在“三十年战争”中取得军事胜利的鼎盛时期，

sentences.en: had dictated her measurements and armament.
sentences.native: 规定了她的尺寸和武器。

sentences.en: Triple gun-decks mounted sixty-four bronze cannon.
sentences.native: 三重炮甲板上装有六十四门青铜大炮。

sentences.en: She was intended to play a leading role in the growing might of Sweden.
sentences.native: 她的目的是在瑞典日益强大的力量中发挥领导作用。

sentences.en: As she was prepared for her maiden voyage on August 10, 1628, Stockholm was in a ferment.
sentences.native: 1628 年 8 月 10 日，当她​​准备首次航行时，斯德哥尔摩正处于骚动之中。

sentences.en: From the Skeppsbron and surrounding islands
sentences.native: 从 Skeppsbron 及周边岛屿出发

sentences.en: the people watched this thing of beauty begin to spread her sails and catch the wind.
sentences.native: 人们看着这美丽的事物开始扬帆迎风。

sentences.en: They had laboured for three years to produce this floating work of art;
sentences.native: 他们花了三年的时间才制作出这件漂浮的艺术品；

sentences.en: she was more richly carved and ornamented than any previous ship.
sentences.native: 她的雕刻和装饰比以前的任何一艘船都更加丰富。

sentences.en: The high stern castle was a riot of carved gods, demons, knights, kings, warriors,
sentences.native: 高高的船尾城堡里雕刻着众神、恶魔、骑士、国王、武士，

sentences.en: mermaids, cherubs; and zoomorphic animal shapes ablaze with red and gold and blue,
sentences.native: 美人鱼、小天使；以及闪耀着红色、金色和蓝色的动物形状，

sentences.en: symbols of courage, power, and cruelty,
sentences.native: 勇气、力量和残酷的象征，

sentences.en: were portrayed to stir the imaginations of the superstitious sailors of the day.
sentences.native: 被描绘成激发当时迷信水手的想象力。

sentences.en: Then the cannons of the anchored warships thundered a salute to which the Vasa fired in reply.
sentences.native: 随后，停泊的战舰上的大炮鸣响了雷鸣般的礼炮，瓦萨号也鸣枪回应。

sentences.en: As she emerged from her drifting cloud of gun smoke with the water churned to foam beneath her bow,
sentences.native: 当她从飘散的炮烟云中出现时，船头下的水翻腾着泡沫，

sentences.en: her flags flying, pennants waving, sails filling in the breeze,
sentences.native: 她的旗帜飘扬，锦旗飘扬，风帆在微风中扬起，

sentences.en: and the red and gold or her superstructure ablaze with colour,
sentences.native: 红色和金色或她的上层建筑闪耀着色彩，

sentences.en: she presented a more majestic spectacle than Stockholmers had ever seen before.
sentences.native: 她呈现出斯德哥尔摩人前所未见的壮丽景象。

sentences.en: All gun-ports were open and the muzzles peeped wickedly from them.
sentences.native: 所有的炮口都敞开着，枪口邪恶地从炮口中探出头来。

sentences.en: As the wind freshened there came a sudden squall and the ship made a strange movement, listing to port.
sentences.native: 当风刮得更猛烈时，突然刮起了狂风，船做出了奇怪的动作，向左舷倾斜。

sentences.en: The Ordnance officer ordered all the port cannon to be heaved to starboard
sentences.native: 军械官员命令将所有左舷大炮移至右舷

sentences.en: to counteract the list but the steepening angle of the decks increased.
sentences.native: 为了抵消倾斜，但甲板的陡峭角度增加了。

sentences.en: Then the sound of rumbling thunder reached the watchers on the shore,
sentences.native: 然后隆隆的雷声传到了岸边的守望者那里，

sentences.en: as cargo, ballast, ammunition and 400 people went sliding and crashing down to the port side of the steeply listing ship.
sentences.native: 货物、压载物、弹药和 400 人滑落并坠落到这艘陡峭倾斜的船的左舷。

sentences.en: The lower gun-ports were now below water and the inrush sealed the ship's fate.
sentences.native: 下部的炮口现在已经在水下，涌入的水流决定了这艘船的命运。

sentences.en: In that first glorious hour, the mighty Vasa, which was intended to rule the Baltic,
sentences.native: 在第一个辉煌的时刻，强大的瓦萨号原本打算统治波罗的海，

sentences.en: sank with all flags flying--in the harbour of her birth.
sentences.native: 在她出生的港口里，所有的旗帜都飘扬着沉没了。

sentences.en: This is a sceptical age,
sentences.native: 这是一个充满怀疑的时代，

sentences.en: but although our faith in many of the things in which our forefathers fervently believed has weakened,
sentences.native: 尽管我们对我们祖先所热切相信的许多事物的信心已经减弱，

sentences.en: our confidence in the curative properties of the bottle of medicine remains the same as theirs.
sentences.native: 我们对这瓶药的疗效的信心与他们一样。

sentences.en: This modern faith in medicines is proved by the fact
sentences.native: 事实证明了现代人对药物的信仰

sentences.en: that the annual drug bill of the Health Services is mounting to astronomical figures.
sentences.native: 卫生服务部门每年的药品费用正在上升到天文数字。

sentences.en: and shows no signs at present of ceasing to rise.
sentences.native: 目前还没有显示出停止上升的迹象。

sentences.en: The majority of the patients attending the medical out-patients departments of our hospitals feel that
sentences.native: 到本院医疗门诊就诊的大多数患者都认为

sentences.en: they have not received adequate treatment unless they are able to carry home with them
sentences.native: 他们没有得到足够的治疗，除非他们能够带回家
