sentences.en: some tangible remedy in the shape of a bottle of medicine,
sentences.native: 一些有形的补救措施，如一瓶药物，

sentences.en: a box of pills, or a small jar of ointment,
sentences.native: 一盒药片，或一小罐药膏，

sentences.en: and the doctor in charge of the department is only too ready to provide them with these requirements.
sentences.native: 科室的负责医生非常乐意满足他们的这些要求。

sentences.en: There is no quicker method of disposing of patients than by giving them what they are asking for,
sentences.native: 处理病人的方法没有比满足他们的要求更快的了，

sentences.en: and since most medical men in the Health Services are overworked
sentences.native: 由于卫生服务部门的大多数医务人员都工作过度

sentences.en: and have little time for offering time-consuming and little-appreciated advice on such subjects as diet,
sentences.native: 几乎没有时间就饮食等主题提供耗时且不被重视的建议，

sentences.en: right living, and the need for abandoning bad habits etc.,
sentences.native: 正确的生活，以及放弃不良习惯的需要等，

sentences.en: the bottle, the box, and the jar are almost always granted them.
sentences.native: 瓶子、盒子和罐子几乎总是被授予的。

sentences.en: Nor is it only the ignorant and ill-educated person who has such faith in the bottle of medicine.
sentences.native: 并不是只有无知和没有受过教育的人才会对那瓶药抱有如此的信心。

sentences.en: It is recounted of Thomas Carlyle that when he heard of the illness of his friend, Henry Taylor,
sentences.native: 据托马斯·卡莱尔回忆，当他听说他的朋友亨利·泰勒患病时，

sentences.en: he went off immediately to visit him,
sentences.native: 他立即前去探望他，

sentences.en: carrying with him in his pocket what remained a bottle of medicine formerly prescribed for an indisposition of Mrs. Carlyle's.
sentences.native: 他口袋里还揣着一瓶以前为卡莱尔夫人的身体不适开的药。

sentences.en: Carlyle was entirely ignorant of what the bottle in his pocket contained,
sentences.native: 卡莱尔完全不知道他口袋里的瓶子里装的是什么，

sentences.en: of the nature of the illness from which his friend was suffering,
sentences.native: 他的朋友所患疾病的性质，

sentences.en: and of what had previously been wrong with his wife,
sentences.native: 以及他妻子之前的问题，

sentences.en: but a medicine that had worked so well in one form of illness would surely be of equal benefit in another,
sentences.native: 但是一种药物在治疗一种疾病时效果很好，对于另一种疾病也同样有效，

sentences.en: and comforted by the thought of the help he was bringing to his friend,
sentences.native: 想到他为朋友带来的帮助，他感到很安慰，

sentences.en: he hastened to Henry Taylor's house.
sentences.native: 他赶紧赶到亨利·泰勒家。

sentences.en: History does not relate whether his friend accepted his medical help, but in all probability he did.
sentences.native: 历史并没有记载他的朋友是否接受了他的医疗帮助，但他很可能接受了。

sentences.en: The great advantage of taking medicine is that it makes no demands on the taker
sentences.native: 服药的最大好处是对服药者没有任何要求

sentences.en: beyond that of putting up for a moment with a disgusting taste,
sentences.native: 除了暂时忍受恶心的味道之外，

sentences.en: and that is what all patients demand of their doctors--to be cured at no inconvenience to themselves.
sentences.native: 这就是所有病人对医生的要求——在不给自己带来任何不便的情况下得到治愈。

sentences.en: Many strange new means of transport have been developed in our century,
sentences.native: 本世纪已经开发出许多奇怪的新交通工具，

sentences.en: the strangest of them being perhaps the hovercraft.
sentences.native: 其中最奇怪的也许是气垫船。

sentences.en: In 1953, a former electronics engineer in his fifties, Christopher Cockerell,
sentences.native: 1953 年，五十多岁的前电子工程师 Christopher Cockerell，

sentences.en: who had turned to boat-building on the Norfolk Broads,
sentences.native: 他们转向在诺福克湖区造船，

sentences.en: suggested an idea on which he had been working for many years to the British Government and industrial circles.
sentences.native: 向英国政府和工业界提出了他多年来一直致力于研究的一个想法。

sentences.en: It was the idea of supporting a craft on a 'pad', or cushion, of low-pressure air, ringed with a curtain of higher pressure air.
sentences.native: 这个想法是将飞行器支撑在低压空气的“垫”或垫子上，周围环绕着高压空气幕。

sentences.en: Ever since, people have had difficulty in deciding whether the craft should be ranged among ships, planes,
sentences.native: 从那时起，人们就很难决定该飞行器是否应该属于船舶、飞机、

sentences.en: or land vehicles--for it is something in between a boat and an aircraft.
sentences.native: 或陆地车辆——因为它介于船和飞机之间。

sentences.en: As a shipbuilder, Cockerell was trying to find a solution to the problem of the wave resistance which wastes a good deal of a surface ship's power and limits its speed.
sentences.native: 作为一名造船商，科克雷尔试图找到解决波浪阻力问题的方法，波浪阻力浪费了水面舰艇的大量动力并限制了其速度。

sentences.en: His answer was to lift the vessel out of the water by making it ride on a cushion of air, no more than one or two feet thick.
sentences.native: 他的答案是让船只在不超过一两英尺厚的气垫上行驶，将其从水中抬起。

sentences.en: This is done by a great number of ring-shaped air jets on the bottom of the craft.
sentences.native: 这是通过飞行器底部的大量环形喷气口来完成的。

sentences.en: It 'flies', therefore, but it cannot fly higher--its action depends on the surface, water or ground, over which it rides.
sentences.native: 因此，它“飞”，但它不能飞得更高——它的行动取决于它所骑过的表面、水或地面。

sentences.en: The first tests on the Solent in 1959 caused a sensation.
sentences.native: 1959 年在索伦特海峡进行的首次测试引起了轰动。

sentences.en: The hovercraft travelled first over the water, then mounted the beach, climbed up the dunes, and sat down on a road.
sentences.native: 气垫船首先在水面上航行，然后登上海滩，爬上沙丘，最后停在路上。

sentences.en: Later it crossed the Channel, riding smoothly over the waves, which presented no problem.
sentences.native: 后来它横渡英吉利海峡，平稳地渡过海浪，没有出现任何问题。

sentences.en: Since that time, various types of hovercraft have appeared and taken up regular service.
sentences.native: 从那时起，各种类型的气垫船出现并开始定期服役。

sentences.en: The hovercraft is particularly useful in large areas with poor communications such as Africa or Australia;
sentences.native: 气垫船在非洲或澳大利亚等交通不便的大片地区特别有用；

sentences.en: it can become a 'flying fruit-bowl', carrying bananas from the plantations to the ports;
sentences.native: 它可以成为“飞行的水果碗”，将香蕉从种植园运送到港口；

sentences.en: giant hovercraft liners could span the Atlantic;
sentences.native: 巨型气垫船可以跨越大西洋；

sentences.en: and the railway of the future may well be the 'hovertrain',
sentences.native: 未来的铁路很可能是“气垫列车”，

sentences.en: riding on its air cushion over a single rail, which it never touches, at speeds, up to 300 m.p.h.--the possibilities appear unlimited.
sentences.native: 骑在它的气垫上，以高达 300 英里/小时的速度行驶在一条从未接触过的轨道上——可能性似乎是无限的。

sentences.en: Our knowledge of the oceans a hundred years ago was confined to the two-dimensional shape of the sea surface
sentences.native: 一百年前我们对海洋的了解仅限于海面的二维形状

sentences.en: and the hazards of navigation presented by the irregularities in depth of the shallow water close to the land.
sentences.native: 以及由于靠近陆地的浅水深度不规则而带来的航行危险。

sentences.en: The open sea was deep and mysterious,
sentences.native: 大海深邃而神秘，

sentences.en: and anyone who gave more than a passing thought to the bottom confines of the oceans probably assumed that the sea-bed was flat.
sentences.native: 任何对海洋底部有过深入思考的人都可能认为海床是平坦的。

sentences.en: Sir James Clark Ross had obtained a sounding of over 2, 400 fathoms in 1839,
sentences.native: 詹姆斯·克拉克·罗斯爵士 (Sir James Clark Ross) 于 1839 年测得超过 2, 400 英寻的深度，

sentences.en: but it was not until 1869, when H.M.S. Porcupine was put at the disposal of the Royal Society for several cruises
sentences.native: 但直到 1869 年，H.M.S.豪猪号曾多次被英国皇家学会使用并进行巡游

sentences.en: that a series of deep soundings was obtained in the Atlantic and the first samples were collected by dredging the bottom.
sentences.native: 在大西洋进行了一系列深度探测，并通过疏浚海底收集了第一批样本。

sentences.en: Shortly after this the famous H.M.S. Challenger expedition established the study of the sea-floor
sentences.native: 此后不久，著名的 H.M.S.挑战者号探险队建立了海底研究

sentences.en: as a subject worthy of the most qualified physicists and geologists.
sentences.native: 作为值得最有资格的物理学家和地质学家研究的课题。

sentences.en: A burst of activity associated with the laying of submarine cables
sentences.native: 与海底电缆铺设相关的一系列活动

sentences.en: soon confirmed the Challenger's observation that many parts of the ocean were two to three miles deep,
sentences.native: 很快证实了挑战者号的观察，即海洋的许多部分有两到三英里深，

sentences.en: and the existence of underwater features of considerable magnitude.
sentences.native: 以及存在相当大的水下特征。

sentences.en: Today, enough soundings are available to enable a relief map of the Atlantic to be drawn
sentences.native: 今天，有足够的探测数据可以绘制大西洋的地形图

sentences.en: and we know something of the great variety of the sea bed's topography.
sentences.native: 我们对海底地形的多样性有所了解。

sentences.en: Since the sea covers the greater part of the earth's surface,
sentences.native: 由于海洋覆盖了地球表面的大部分，

sentences.en: it is quite reasonable to regard the sea floor as the basic form of the crust of the earth,
sentences.native: 将海底视为地壳的基本形态是相当合理的，

sentences.en: with superimposed upon it the continents,
sentences.native: 其上叠加着大陆，

sentences.en: together with the islands and other features of the oceans.
sentences.native: 连同岛屿和海洋的其他特征。

sentences.en: The continents form rugged tablelands which stand nearly three miles above the floor of the open ocean.
sentences.native: 这些大陆形成崎岖的台地，高出公海海底近三英里。

sentences.en: From the shore line, out to a distance which may be anywhere from a few miles to a few hundred miles,
sentences.native: 从海岸线出发，距离可能从几英里到几百英里不等，

sentences.en: runs the gentle slope of the continental shelf, geologically part of the continents.
sentences.native: 沿着大陆架的缓坡延伸，大陆架在地质上是大陆的一部分。

sentences.en: The real dividing line between continents and oceans occurs at the foot of a steeper slope.
sentences.native: 大陆和海洋之间的真正分界线出现在更陡峭的斜坡脚下。

sentences.en: This continental slope usually starts at a place somewhere near the 100-fathom mark
sentences.native: 这个大陆坡通常起始于 100 英寻附近的某个地方

sentences.en: and in the course of a few hundred miles reaches the true ocean floor at 2, 500-3, 500 fathoms.
sentences.native: 在数百英里的路程中到达真正的海底 2, 500-3, 500 噚。

sentences.en: The slope averages about 1 in 30, but contains steep,
sentences.native: 坡度平均约为 30 分之一，但包含陡峭、

sentences.en: probably vertical, cliffs, and gentle sediment-covered terraces,
sentences.native: 可能是垂直的悬崖和平缓的沉积物覆盖的阶地，

sentences.en: and near its lower reaches there is a long tailing-off which is almost certainly the result of
sentences.native: 在其下游附近，出现了长时间的尾流，这几乎肯定是由于

sentences.en: material transported out to deep water after being eroded from the continental masses.
sentences.native: 物质从大陆块受到侵蚀后被输送到深水中。

sentences.en: Appreciation of sculpture depends upon the ability to respond to form in 3 dimensions.
sentences.native: 对雕塑的欣赏取决于对三维形式做出反应的能力。

sentences.en: That is perhaps why sculpture has been described as the most difficult of all arts;
sentences.native: 这也许就是为什么雕塑被称为所有艺术中最难的一门。

sentences.en: certainly it is more difficult than the arts which involve appreciation of flat forms, shape in only two dimensions.
sentences.native: 当然，它比涉及平面形式、仅二维形状的艺术的欣赏更困难。

sentences.en: Many more people are 'form-blind' than colour-blind.
sentences.native: “色盲”的人比“色盲”的人多得多。

sentences.en: The child learning to see, first distinguishes only two-dimensional shape; it cannot judge distances, depths.
sentences.native: 孩子在学习看东西时，首先只能区分二维形状；它无法判断距离、深度。

sentences.en: Later, for its personal safety and practical needs, it has to develop (partly by means of touch) the ability to judge roughly 3-dimensonal distances.
sentences.native: 后来，出于人身安全和实际需要，它必须发展（部分通过触摸）判断大致3维距离的能力。

sentences.en: But having satisfied the requirements of practical necessity, most people go no further.
sentences.native: 但在满足了现实需要后，大多数人就不再继续了。

sentences.en: Though they may attain considerable accuracy in the perception of flat form,
sentences.native: 尽管他们在感知平面形状方面可能获得相当高的准确性，

sentences.en: they do not make the further intellectual and emotional effort needed to comprehend form in its full spatial existence.
sentences.native: 他们没有付出进一步的智力和情感努力来理解形式的完整空间存在。

sentences.en: This is what the sculptor must do.
sentences.native: 这是雕塑家必须做的。

sentences.en: He must strive continually to think of and use, form in its full spatial completeness.
sentences.native: 他必须不断努力思考和使用形式的完整空间完整性。

sentences.en: He gets the solid shape as it were, inside his head--he thinks of it, whatever its size, as if he were holding it completely enclosed in the hollow of his hand.
sentences.native: 他在他的脑袋里得到了原来的实体形状——他想到了它，无论它有多大，就好像他把它完全封闭在他的手掌中一样。

sentences.en: He mentally visualizes a complex form from all round itself;
sentences.native: 他在脑海中想象出一个来自四周的复杂形状；

sentences.en: he knows while he looks at one side what the other side is like; he identifies himself with its centre of gravity, its mass, its weight;
sentences.native: 当他看一侧时，他知道另一侧是什么样子；他用它的重心、质量、重量来识别自己；

sentences.en: he realizes its volume as the space that the shape displaces in the air.
sentences.native: 他意识到它的体积是形状在空气中所取代的空间。

sentences.en: And the sensitive observer of sculpture must also learn to feel shape simply as shape, not as description or reminiscence.
sentences.native: 敏感的雕塑观察者也必须学会将形状仅仅作为形状来感受，而不是作为描述或回忆。

sentences.en: He must, for example, perceive an egg as a simple single solid shape quite apart from its significance as food,
sentences.native: 例如，他必须将鸡蛋视为一个简单的单一固体形状，而与它作为食物的意义无关，

sentences.en: or from the literary idea that it will become a bird.
sentences.native: 或者来自它会变成一只鸟的文学观念。

sentences.en: And so with solids such as a shell, a nut, a plum, a pear, a tadpole, a mushroom,
sentences.native: 对于诸如贝壳、坚果、李子、梨、蝌蚪、蘑菇等固体，

sentences.en: a mountain peak, a kidney, a carrot, a tree-trunk, a bird, a bud, a lark, a ladybird, a bulrush, a bone.
sentences.native: 一座山峰、一颗肾脏、一根胡萝卜、一根树干、一只鸟、一个花蕾、一只云雀、一只瓢虫、一根芦苇、一根骨头。

sentences.en: From these he can go on to appreciate more complex forms or combinations of several forms.
sentences.native: 由此，他可以继续欣赏更复杂的形式或几种形式的组合。

sentences.en: In his own lifetime Galileo was the centre of violent controversy, but the scientific dust has long since settled,
sentences.native: 伽利略在世时曾是激烈争论的中心，但科学尘埃早已尘埃落定，

sentences.en: and today we can see even his famous clash with the Inquisition in something like its proper perspective.
sentences.native: 今天，我们甚至可以从正确的角度来看待他与宗教裁判所的著名冲突。

sentences.en: But, in contrast, it is only in modern times that Galileo has become a problem child for historians of science.
sentences.native: 但相比之下，直到现代伽利略才成为科学史学家的问题儿童。

sentences.en: The old view of Galileo was delightfully uncomplicated.
sentences.native: 伽利略的旧观点非常简单。

sentences.en: He was, above all, a man who experimented:
sentences.native: 最重要的是，他是一个敢于尝试的人：

sentences.en: who despised the prejudice and book learning of the Aristotelians,
sentences.native: 他们鄙视亚里士多德学派的偏见和书本知识，

sentences.en: who put his questions to nature instead of to the ancients, and who drew his conclusions fearlessly.
sentences.native: 他向自然而不是向古人提出问题，并且无所畏惧地得出结论。

sentences.en: He had been the first to turn a telescope to the sky,
sentences.native: 他是第一个将望远镜转向天空的人

sentences.en: and he had seen there evidence enough to overthrow Aristotle and Ptolemy together.
sentences.native: 他已经看到了足以推翻亚里士多德和托勒密的证据。

sentences.en: He was the man who climbed the Leaning Tower of Pisa and dropped various weights from the top,
sentences.native: 他是那个登上比萨斜塔并从塔顶扔下各种重物的人，

sentences.en: who rolled balls down inclined planes, and then generalized the results of his many experiments into the famous law of free fall.
sentences.native: 他将球滚下斜面，然后将他的许多实验结果推广到著名的自由落体定律。

sentences.en: But a closer study of the evidence,
sentences.native: 但仔细研究证据后，

sentences.en: supported by a deeper sense of the period, and particularly by a new consciousness of the philosophical undercurrents in the scientific revolution,
sentences.native: 受到对那个时代更深刻的认识的支持，特别是对科学革命中哲学暗流的新意识的支持，

sentences.en: has profoundly modified this view of Galileo.
sentences.native: 深刻地改变了伽利略的这一观点。

sentences.en: Today, although the old Galileo lives on in many popular writings, among historians of science a new and more sophisticated picture has emerged.
sentences.native: 如今，尽管古老的伽利略在许多流行著作中仍然存在，但科学史学家们却出现了一幅新的、更复杂的图景。

sentences.en: At the same time our sympathy for Galileo's opponents has grown somewhat.
sentences.native: 与此同时，我们对伽利略的反对者的同情有所增加。

sentences.en: His telescopic observations are justly immortal;
sentences.native: 他的望远镜观察结果确实是不朽的。

sentences.en: they aroused great interest at the time,
sentences.native: 当时引起了极大的兴趣，

sentences.en: they had important theoretical consequences,
sentences.native: 它们产生了重要的理论后果，

sentences.en: and they provided a striking demonstration of the potentialities hidden in instruments and apparatus.
sentences.native: 他们惊人地展示了仪器和设备中隐藏的潜力。

sentences.en: But can we blame those who looked and failed to see what Galileo saw,
sentences.native: 但是我们能责怪那些看过却没有看到伽利略所看到的东西的人吗？

sentences.en: if we remember that to use a telescope at the limit of its powers calls for long experience and intimate familiarity with one's instrument?
sentences.native: 我们是否还记得，要在其能力的极限范围内使用望远镜需要长期的经验和对仪器的熟悉？

sentences.en: Was the philosopher who refused to look through Galileo's telescope more culpable than those who alleged
sentences.native: 拒绝通过伽利略望远镜观察的哲学家是否比那些声称自己有罪的哲学家更有罪？

sentences.en: that the spiral nebulae observed with Lord Rosse's great telescope in the 1840s were scratches left by the grinder?
sentences.native: 1840 年代用罗斯勋爵的大望远镜观测到的螺旋星云是研磨机留下的划痕？

sentences.en: We can perhaps forgive those who said the moons of Jupiter were produced by Galileo's spyglass if we recall that in his day,
sentences.native: 如果我们记得在他那个时代，我们也许可以原谅那些说木星的卫星是由伽利略望远镜产生的人，

sentences.en: as for centuries before, curved glass was the popular contrivance for producing not truth but illusion, untruth;
sentences.native: 与几个世纪前一样，曲面玻璃是一种流行的发明，它产生的不是真理，而是幻觉和谎言。

sentences.en: and if a single curved glass would distort nature, how much more would a pair of them?
sentences.native: 如果单块曲面玻璃都会扭曲自然，那么一对曲面玻璃更会扭曲自然吗？

sentences.en: Education is one of the key words of our time.
sentences.native: 教育是我们这个时代的关键词之一。

sentences.en: A man without an education, many of us believe,
sentences.native: 我们许多人相信，一个没有受过教育的人，

sentences.en: is an unfortunate victim of adverse circumstances, deprived of one of the greatest twentieth-century opportunities.
sentences.native: 是不利环境的不幸受害者，被剥夺了二十世纪最伟大的机会之一。

sentences.en: Convinced of the importance of education, modern states 'invest' in institutions of learning to get back 'interest'
sentences.native: 现代国家深信教育的重要性，对学习机构进行“投资”以收回“兴趣”

sentences.en: in the form of a large group of enlightened young men and women who are potential leaders.
sentences.native: 以一大群开明的年轻男女为形式，他们是潜在的领导者。

sentences.en: Education, with its cycles of instruction so carefully worked out,
sentences.native: 教育的教学周期经过精心设计，

sentences.en: punctuated by textbooks--those purchasable wells of wisdom--what would civilization be like without its benefits?
sentences.native: 夹杂着教科书——那些可以购买的智慧之井——如果没有它的好处，文明会是什么样子？

sentences.en: So much is certain: that we would have doctors and preachers,
sentences.native: 非常确定的是：我们会有医生和传教士，

sentences.en: lawyers and defendants marriages and births--but our spiritual outlook would be different.
sentences.native: 律师和被告的婚姻和出生——但我们的精神面貌会有所不同。

sentences.en: We would lay less stress on 'facts and figures' and more on a good memory,
sentences.native: 我们会更少强调“事实和数字”，而更多地强调良好的记忆力，

sentences.en: on applied psychology, and on the capacity of a man to get along with his fellow-citizens.
sentences.native: 应用心理学以及一个人与同胞相处的能力。

sentences.en: If our educational system were fashioned after its bookless past we would have the most democratic form of 'college' imaginable.
sentences.native: 如果我们的教育体系是按照过去无书本的方式建立的，我们就会拥有可以想象到的最民主的“大学”形式。

sentences.en: Among tribal people all knowledge inherited by tradition is shared by all;
sentences.native: 在部落人民中，所有传统继承的知识都是所有人共享的；

sentences.en: it is taught to every member of the tribe so that in this respect everybody is equally equipped for life.
sentences.native: 它被传授给部落的每个成员，以便在这方面每个人都平等地为生活做好准备。

sentences.en: It is the ideal condition of the 'equal start' which only our most progressive forms of modern education try to regain.
sentences.native: 这是“平等起点”的理想条件，只有我们最进步的现代教育形式才试图重新获得这种条件。

sentences.en: In primitive cultures the obligation to seek and to receive the traditional instruction is binding to all.
sentences.native: 在原始文化中，寻求和接受传统指导的义务对所有人都有约束力。

sentences.en: There are no'illiterates' --if the term can be applied to peoples without a script--while our own compulsory school attendance became law in Germany in 1642,
sentences.native: 不存在‘文盲’——如果这个词可以适用于没有文字的人的话——而我们自己的义务教育在 1642 年在德国成为法律，

sentences.en: in France in 1806, and in England in 1876 and is still nonexistent in a number of 'civilized' nations.
sentences.native: 1806 年在法国，1876 年在英国，但在许多“文明”国家仍然不存在。

sentences.en: This shows how long it was before we deemed it necessary to make sure
sentences.native: 这表明我们花了多长时间才认为有必要确保

sentences.en: that all our children could share in the knowledge accumulated by the 'happy few' during the past centuries.
sentences.native: 我们所有的孩子都可以分享过去几个世纪中“少数幸运儿”所积累的知识。

sentences.en: Education in the wilderness is not a matter of monetary means.
sentences.native: 荒野教育不是金钱问题。

sentences.en: All are entitled to an equal start.
sentences.native: 所有人都有权享有平等的起点。

sentences.en: There is none of the hurry which, in our society, often hampers the full development of a growing personality.
sentences.native: 在我们的社会中，没有任何匆忙常常会阻碍成长中的个性的充分发展。

sentences.en: There, a child grows up under the everpresent attention of his parents;
sentences.native: 在那里，孩子在父母无时无刻的关注下成长；

sentences.en: therefore the jungles and the savannahs know of no 'juvenile delinquency'.
sentences.native: 因此，丛林和大草原上不存在“青少年犯罪”。

sentences.en: No necessity of making a living away from home results in neglect of children, and no father is confronted with his inability to 'buy' an education for his child.
sentences.native: 离家谋生的必要性不会导致对孩子的忽视，也没有哪个父亲会面临无法为孩子“购买”教育的情况。

sentences.en: Parents are often upset when their children praise the homes of their friends and regard it as a slur on their own cooking, or cleaning, or furniture,
sentences.native: 当孩子称赞朋友的家并认为这是对自己做饭、清洁或家具的侮辱时，父母常常会感到不安，

sentences.en: and often are foolish enough to let the adolescents see that they are annoyed.
sentences.native: 而且常常愚蠢到让青少年看出他们很生气。

sentences.en: They may even accuse them of disloyalty, or make some spiteful remark about the friends' parents.
sentences.native: 他们甚至可能指责他们不忠诚，或者对朋友的父母进行一些恶毒的评论。

sentences.en: Such a loss of dignity and descent into childish behaviour on the part of the adults deeply shocks the adolescents,
sentences.native: 成年人这种丧失尊严、陷入幼稚的行为让青少年深感震惊，

sentences.en: and makes them resolve that in future they will not talk to their parents about the places or people they visit.
sentences.native: 并让他们下定决心，今后不再与父母谈论他们去过的地方或去过的人。

sentences.en: Before very long the parents will be complaining that the child is so secretive and never tells them anything,
sentences.native: 不久父母就会抱怨孩子太遮遮掩掩，什么都不告诉他们，

sentences.en: but they seldom realize that they have brought this on themselves.
sentences.native: 但他们很少意识到这是他们自己造成的。

sentences.en: Disillusionment with the parents,
however good and adequate they may be both as parents and as individuals, is to some degree inevitable.
sentences.native: 无论作为父母和个人，他们多么优秀和足够，在某种程度上都是不可避免的。

sentences.en: Most children have such a high ideal of their parents,
sentences.native: 大多数孩子都对父母抱有如此崇高的理想，

sentences.en: unless the parents themselves have been unsatisfactory, that it can hardly hope to stand up to a realistic evaluation.
sentences.native: 除非父母本身已经不满意，否则很难经得起现实的评价。

sentences.en: Parents would be greatly surprised and deeply touched if they realized how much belief their children usually have in their character and infallibility,
sentences.native: 如果父母意识到他们的孩子通常对自己的品格和正确性有多大的信心，他们会感到非常惊讶和深深的感动，

sentences.en: and how much this faith means to a child.
sentences.native: 这种信仰对于一个孩子来说意味着什么？

sentences.en: If parents were prepared for this adolescent reaction,
sentences.native: 如果父母对青少年的这种反应有所准备，

sentences.en: and realized that was a sign that the child was growing up
sentences.native: 并意识到这是孩子长大的标志

sentences.en: and developing valuable powers of observation and independent judgment,
sentences.native: 并发展宝贵的观察力和独立判断力，

sentences.en: they would not be so hurt, and therefore would not drive the child into opposition by resenting and resisting it.
sentences.native: 他们不会受到如此的伤害，因此不会通过怨恨和抵抗来驱使孩子反对。

sentences.en: The adolescent, with his passion for sincerity,
sentences.native: 少年以他的热情真诚，

sentences.en: always respects a parent who admits that he is wrong, or ignorant,
sentences.native: 总是尊重承认自己错误或无知的父母，

sentences.en: or even that he has been unfair or unjust.
sentences.native: 甚至说他不公平或不公正。

sentences.en: What the child cannot forgive is the parents' refusal to admit these charges if the child knows them to be true.
sentences.native: 孩子无法原谅的是，如果孩子知道这些指控是真实的，父母却拒绝承认这些指控。

sentences.en: Victorian parents believed that they kept their dignity by retreating behind an unreasoning authoritarian attitude in fact they did nothing of the kind,
sentences.native: 维多利亚时代的父母认为，他们通过退却不合理的专制态度来保持尊严，事实上他们没有这样做，

sentences.en: but children were then too cowed to let them know how they really felt.
sentences.native: 但孩子们当时太害怕了，不敢让他们知道自己的真实感受。

sentences.en: Today we tend to go to the other extreme,
sentences.native: 今天我们往往走向另一个极端，

sentences.en: but on the whole this is a healthier attitude both for the child and the parent.
sentences.native: 但总的来说，这对孩子和父母来说都是一种更健康的态度。

sentences.en: It is always wiser and safer to face up to reality, however painful it may be at the moment.
sentences.native: 无论此刻多么痛苦，面对现实总是更明智、更安全的做法。

sentences.en: The Moon is likely to become the industrial hub of the Solar System supplying the rocket fuels for its ships,
sentences.native: 月球很可能成为太阳系的工业中心，为其飞船提供火箭燃料，

sentences.en: easily obtainable from the lunar rocks in the form of liquid oxygen.
sentences.native: 很容易从月球岩石中以液氧的形式获得。

sentences.en: The reason lies in its gravity.
sentences.native: 原因就在于它的重力。

sentences.en: Because the Moon has only an eightieth of the Earth's mass,
sentences.native: 因为月球的质量只有地球的八十分之一，

sentences.en: it requires 97% less energy
sentences.native: 所需能源减少 97%

sentences.en: to travel the quarter of a million miles from the Moon to Earth-orbit than the 200 mile-journey from Earth's surface into orbit!
sentences.native: 从月球到地球轨道行驶 25 万英里比从地球表面进入轨道 200 英里的旅程还要多！

sentences.en: This may sound fantastic, but it is easily calculated.
sentences.native: 这听起来可能很不可思议，但很容易计算。

sentences.en: To escape from the Earth in a rocket, one must travel at seven miles per second.
sentences.native: 要乘坐火箭逃离地球，必须以每秒七英里的速度行驶。

sentences.en: The comparable speed from the Moon is only 1.5 miles per second.
sentences.native: 从月球出发的可比速度仅为每秒 1.5 英里。

sentences.en: Because the gravity on the Moon's surface is only a sixth of Earth's (remember how easily the Apollo astronauts bounded along),
sentences.native: 因为月球表面的重力只有地球的六分之一（还记得阿波罗宇航员是多么轻松地跳跃），

sentences.en: it takes much less energy to accelerate to that 1.5mps than it does on Earth.
sentences.native: 加速到 1.5mps 所需的能量比在地球上少得多。

sentences.en: Moon dwellers will be able to fly in space at only three percent of the cost of similar journeys by their terrestrial cousins.
sentences.native: 月球居民将能够在太空中飞行，而成本仅为其陆地表亲类似旅程的百分之三。

sentences.en: Arthur C.Clark once suggested a revolutionary idea passes through three phases:
sentences.native: 亚瑟·C·克拉克 (Arthur C.Clark) 曾经提出，一个革命性的想法要经历三个阶段：

sentences.en: 1.  'It's impossible--don't waste my time.'
sentences.native: 1.“这是不可能的——别浪费我的时间。”

sentences.en: 2.  'It's possible, but not worth doing.'
sentences.native: 2.“这是可能的，但不值得这样做。”

sentences.en: 3.  'I said it was a good idea all along.'
sentences.native: 3.“我一直说这是个好主意。”

sentences.en: The idea of colonising Mars--a world 160 times more distant than the Moon--will move decisively from the second phase to the third,
sentences.native: 殖民火星——一个比月球远160倍的世界——的想法将决定性地从第二阶段转向第三阶段，

sentences.en: when a significant number of people are living permanently in space.
sentences.native: 当相当多的人永久生活在太空中时。

sentences.en: Mars has an extraordinary fascination for would-be voyagers.
sentences.native: 火星对未来的航行者有着非凡的吸引力。

sentences.en: America, Russia and Europe are filled with enthusiasts--many of them serious and senior scientists who dream of sending people to it.
sentences.native: 美国、俄罗斯和欧洲充满了狂热者——其中许多人都是严肃而资深的科学家，梦想着将人们送往那里。

sentences.en: Their aim is understandable.
sentences.native: 他们的目的是可以理解的。

sentences.en: It is the one world in the Solar System that is most like the Earth.
sentences.native: 它是太阳系中最像地球的一个世界。

sentences.en: It is a world of red sandy deserts (hence its name--the Red Planet),
sentences.native: 这是一个红色沙漠的世界（因此得名——红色星球），

sentences.en: cloudless skies, savage sandstorms, chasms wider than the Grand Canyon and at least one mountain more than twice as tall as Everest.
sentences.native: 万里无云的天空、狂暴的沙尘暴、比大峡谷还宽的峡谷，以及至少一座比珠穆朗玛峰高两倍以上的山峰。

sentences.en: It seems ideal for settlement.
sentences.native: 这似乎是解决问题的理想选择。

sentences.en: If a nation is essentialy disunited, it is left to the government to hold it together.
sentences.native: 如果一个国家本质上不团结，就需要政府来维持它。

sentences.en: This increases the expense of government, and reduces correspondingly the amount of economic resources that could be used for developing the country.
sentences.native: 这增加了政府的开支，相应地减少了可用于国家发展的经济资源。

sentences.en: And it should not be forgotten how small those resources are in a poor and backward country.
sentences.native: 我们不应该忘记，在一个贫穷落后的国家，这些资源是多么的少。

sentences.en: Where the cost of government is high, resources for development are correspondingly low.
sentences.native: 政府成本高的地方，发展资源相应就低。

sentences.en: This may be illustrated by comparing the position of a nation with that of a private business enterprise.
sentences.native: 这可以通过将一个国家的地位与一个私营企业的地位进行比较来说明。

sentences.en: An enterprise has to incur certain costs and expenses in order to stay in business.
sentences.native: 企业为了维持经营，必须承担一定的成本和费用。

sentences.en: For our purposes, we are concerned only with one kind of cost--the cost of managing and administering the business.
sentences.native: 就我们的目的而言，我们只关心一种成本——管理和管理业务的成本。

sentences.en: Such administrative overheads in a business are analogous to the cost of government in a nation.
sentences.native: 企业的此类行政管理费用类似于一个国家的政府成本。

sentences.en: The administrative overheads of a business are low to the extent that everyone working in the business
sentences.native: 企业的管理费用很低，企业中的每个人都可以参与其中

sentences.en: can be trusted to behave in a way that best promotes the interests of the firm.
sentences.native: 可以相信其行为方式最有利于公司利益。

sentences.en: If they can each be trusted to take such responsibilities,
sentences.native: 如果他们每个人都能被信任承担这样的责任，

sentences.en: and to exercise such initiative as falls within their sphere, then administrative overheads will be low.
sentences.native: 并在其职责范围内发挥主动性，那么行政管理费用就会很低。

sentences.en: It will be low because it will be necessary to have only one man looking after each job without having another man to check upon what he is doing,
sentences.native: 它会很低，因为每项工作只需一个人负责，而无需另一个人检查他正在做的事情，

sentences.en: keep him in line, and report on him to someone else.
sentences.native: 让他遵守规矩，并向其他人报告他的情况。

sentences.en: But if no one can be trusted to act in a loyal and responsible manner towards his job,
sentences.native: 但如果没有人可以被信任以忠诚和负责任的方式对待他的工作，

sentences.en: then the business will require armies of administrators, checkers and foremen and administrative overheads will rise correspondingly.
sentences.native: 那么企业将需要大量的管理人员、检查员和领班，管理费用也会相应增加。

sentences.en: As administrative overheads rise, so the earnings of the business after meeting the expense of administration, will fall;
sentences.native: 随着管理费用的增加，企业在支付管理费用后的收入将会下降；

sentences.en: and the business will have less money to distribute as dividends or invest directly in its future progress and development.
sentences.native: 而且企业用于分配股息或直接投资于未来进步和发展的资金将会减少。

sentences.en: It is precisely the same with a nation.
sentences.native: 对于一个民族来说也是如此。

sentences.en: To the extent that the people can be relied on to behave in a loyal and responsible manner,
sentences.native: 只要人民能够以忠诚和负责任的方式行事，

sentences.en: the government does not require armies of police and civil servants to keep them in order.
sentences.native: 政府不需要大批警察和公务员来维持秩序。

sentences.en: But if a nation is disunited, the government cannot be sure that the actions of the people will be in the interests of the nation;
sentences.native: 但如果一个国家不团结，政府就不能确定人民的行为是否符合国家的利益；

sentences.en: and it will have to watch, check, and control the people accordingly.
sentences.native: 它必须相应地监视、检查和控制人们。

sentences.en: A disunited nation therefore has to incur unduly high costs of government.
sentences.native: 因此，一个分裂的国家必须承担过高的政府成本。

sentences.en: At the age of twelve years, the human body is at its most vigorous.
sentences.native: 十二岁是人体最旺盛的时期。

sentences.en: It has yet to reach its full size and strength, and its owner his or her full intelligence: but at this age the likelihood of death is least.
sentences.native: 它尚未达到其完整的尺寸和强度，其主人也尚未达到其完整的智力：但在这个年龄，死亡的可能性是最小的。

sentences.en: Earlier, we were infants and young children, and consequently more vulnerable;
sentences.native: 早些时候，我们还是婴儿和幼儿，因此更加脆弱；

sentences.en: later, we shall undergo a progressive loss of our vigour and resistance which, though imperceptible at first
sentences.native: 后来，我们的活力和抵抗力将逐渐丧失，尽管一开始是难以察觉的

sentences.en: will finally become so steep that we can live no longer,
sentences.native: 最终会变得如此陡峭以至于我们无法再活下去，

sentences.en: however well we look after ourselves, and however well society, and our doctors, look after us.
sentences.native: 我们把自己照顾得多么好，社会和我们的医生把我们照顾得多么好。

sentences.en: This decline in vigour with the passing of time is called ageing.
sentences.native: 这种活力随着时间的流逝而下降的现象称为衰老。

sentences.en: It is one of the most unpleasant discoveries which we all make that we must decline in this way, that if we escape wars,
sentences.native: 这是我们所有人都做出的最令人不快的发现之一，我们必须以这种方式衰落，如果我们逃避战争，

sentences.en: accidents and diseases we shall eventually 'die of old age', and that this happens at a rate which differs little from person to person,
sentences.native: 事故和疾病，我们最终将“死于老年”，而且这种情况发生的速度因人而异，

sentences.en: so that there are heavy odds in favour of our dying between the ages of 65 and 80.
sentences.native: 因此，我们在 65 岁到 80 岁之间死亡的可能性很大。

sentences.en: Some of us will die sooner, a few will live longer -- on into a ninth or tenth decade.
sentences.native: 我们中的一些人会死得更快，一些人会活得更久——活到第九个或第十个十年。

sentences.en: But the chances are against it,
sentences.native: 但机会并不大，

sentences.en: and there is a virtual limit on how long we can hope to remain alive, however lucky and robust we are.
sentences.native: 无论我们多么幸运和坚强，我们能活多久实际上是有限的。

sentences.en: Normal people tend to forget this process unless and until they are reminded of it.
sentences.native: 普通人往往会忘记这个过程，除非他们被提醒。

sentences.en: We are so familiar with the fact that man ages, that people have for years assumed that the process of losing vigour with time,
sentences.native: 我们非常熟悉人会衰老的事实，多年来人们一直认为随着时间的流逝而失去活力的过程，

sentences.en: of becoming more likely to die the older we get, was something self-evident
sentences.native: 我们年纪越大，死亡的可能性就越大，这是不言而喻的

sentences.en: like the cooling of a hot kettle or the wearing-out of a pair of shoes.
sentences.native: 就像热水壶的冷却或一双鞋子的磨损一样。

sentences.en: They have also assumed that all animals,
sentences.native: 他们还假设所有动物，

sentences.en: and probably other organisms such as trees, or even the universe itself, must in the nature of things 'wear out'.
sentences.native: 也许其他有机体，例如树木，甚至宇宙本身，在事物的本质上必定会“磨损”。

sentences.en: Most animals we commonly observe do in fact age as we do,
sentences.native: 我们经常观察到的大多数动物实际上都会像我们一样衰老，

sentences.en: if given the chance to live long enough;
sentences.native: 如果有机会活得足够长；

sentences.en: and mechanical systems like a wound watch, or the sun,
sentences.native: 以及机械系统，如上链手表或太阳，

sentences.en: do in fact run out of energy in accordance with the second law of thermodynamics (whether the whole universe does so is a moot point at present).
sentences.native: 事实上，根据热力学第二定律，能量确实耗尽了（目前整个宇宙是否会耗尽能量尚无定论）。

sentences.en: But these are not analogous to what happens when man ages.
sentences.native: 但这些与人类衰老时发生的情况不同。

sentences.en: A run-down watch is still a watch and can be rewound.
sentences.native: 破旧的手表仍然是手表，可以重新上发条。

sentences.en: An old watch, by contrast, becomes so worn and unreliable that it eventually is not worth mending.
sentences.native: 相比之下，旧手表会变得非常磨损且不可靠，最终不值得修理。

sentences.en: But a watch could never repair itself--it does not consist of living parts, only of metal, which wears away by friction.
sentences.native: 但手表永远无法自我修复——它不包含活动部件，仅由金属组成，会因摩擦而磨损。

sentences.en: We could, at one time, repair ourselves--well enough, at least, to overcome all but the most instantly fatal illnesses and accidents.
sentences.native: 我们可以暂时修复自己——至少足以克服除最直接致命的疾病和事故之外的所有疾病和事故。

sentences.en: Between twelve and eighty years we gradually lose this power;
sentences.native: 十二到八十年间，我们逐渐失去了这种力量；

sentences.en: an illness which at 12 would knock us over, at 80 can knock us out, and into our grave.
sentences.native: 这种疾病在 12 岁的时候会让我们崩溃，在 80 岁的时候会把我们击倒，然后进入坟墓。

sentences.en: If we could stay as vigorous as we are at twelve,
sentences.native: 如果我们能像十二岁时那样充满活力，

sentences.en: it would take about 700 years for half of us to die, and another 700 for the survivors to be reduced by half again.
sentences.native: 大约需要700年，我们的一半人就会死亡，而另外700年，幸存者就会再次减少一半。

sentences.en: Contamination of water supplies is usually due to poor sanitation close to water sources,
sentences.native: 供水污染通常是由于水源附近的卫生条件差造成的，

sentences.en: sewage disposal into the sources themselves, leakage of sewage into distribution systems or contamination with industrial or farm waste.
sentences.native: 污水排放到水源本身、污水泄漏到分配系统或被工业或农业废物污染。

sentences.en: Even if a piped water supply is safe at its source, it is not always safe by the time it reaches the tap.
sentences.native: 即使管道供水在其源头是安全的，但到达水龙头时并不总是安全的。

sentences.en: Intermittent tap-water supplies should be regarded as particularly suspect.
sentences.native: 间歇性的自来水供应尤其值得怀疑。

sentences.en: Travellers on short trips to areas with water supplies of uncertain quality
sentences.native: 前往供水质量不稳定地区短途旅行的旅行者

sentences.en: should avoid drinking tap-water, or untreated water from any other source.
sentences.native: 应避免饮用自来水或任何其他来源的未经处理的水。

sentences.en: It is best to keep to hot drinks, bottled or canned drinks of well-known brand names-international standard of water treatment are usually followed at bottling plants.
sentences.native: 最好只喝热饮、知名品牌的瓶装或罐装饮料——装瓶厂通常遵循国际水处理标准。

sentences.en: Carbonated drinks are acidic, and slightly safer.
sentences.native: 碳酸饮料是酸性的，稍微安全一些。

sentences.en: Make sure that all bottles are opened in your presence, and that their rims are clean and dry.
sentences.native: 确保所有瓶子都在您面前打开，并且其边缘干净且干燥。

sentences.en: Boiling is always a good way of treating water.
sentences.native: 煮沸始终是处理水的好方法。

sentences.en: Some hotels supply boiled water on request and this can be used for drinking, or for brushing teeth.
sentences.native: 一些酒店可应要求提供开水，可用于饮用或刷牙。

sentences.en: Portable boiling elements that can boil small quantities of water are useful when the right voltage of electricity is available.
sentences.native: 当电压合适时，可以煮沸少量水的便携式煮沸元件非常有用。

sentences.en: Refuse politely any cold drink from an unknown source.
sentences.native: 礼貌地拒绝任何来源不明的冷饮。

sentences.en: Ice is only as safe as the water from which it is made,
sentences.native: 冰的安全程度取决于其所用的水，

sentences.en: and should not be put in drinks unless it is known to be safe.
sentences.native: 除非已知其安全，否则不应将其放入饮料中。

sentences.en: Drinks can be cooled by placing them on ice rather than adding ice to them.
sentences.native: 饮料可以通过将其放在冰上而不是加冰来冷却。

sentences.en: Alcohol may be a medical disinfectant, but should not be relied upon to sterilize water.
sentences.native: 酒精可能是一种医用消毒剂，但不应依赖它来对水进行消毒。

sentences.en: Ethanol is more effective at a concentration of 50-70 percent;
sentences.native: 乙醇浓度为 50-70% 时更有效；

sentences.en: below 20 per cent, its bactericidal action is negligible.
sentences.native: 低于20%，其杀菌作用可以忽略不计。

sentences.en: Spirits labelled 95 proof contain only about 47 per cent alcohol.
sentences.native: 标有 95 度的烈酒仅含有约 47% 的酒精度。

sentences.en: Beware of methylated alcohol,
sentences.native: 谨防甲基化酒精，

sentences.en: which is very poisonous and should never be added to drinking water.
sentences.native: 它有毒，切勿添加到饮用水中。

sentences.en: If no other safe water supply can be obtained,
sentences.native: 如果无法获得其他安全供水，

sentences.en: tap water that is too hot to touch can be left to cool and is generally safe to drink.
sentences.native: 太热而无法触摸的自来水可以冷却，通常可以安全饮用。

sentences.en: Those planning a trip to remote areas, or intending to live in countries where drinking water is not readily available,
sentences.native: 那些计划前往偏远地区旅行或打算居住在缺乏饮用水的国家的人，

sentences.en: should know about the various possible methods for making water safe.
sentences.native: 应该了解确保水安全的各种可能方法。

sentences.en: I have known very few writers,
sentences.native: 我认识的作家很少，

sentences.en: but those I have known and whom I respect, confess at once that they have little idea where they are going when they first set pen to paper.
sentences.native: 但那些我认识的、我尊敬的人立刻承认，当他们第一次动笔写字时，他们根本不知道自己要去哪里。

sentences.en: They have a character, perhaps two;
sentences.native: 他们有一个性格，也许有两个；

sentences.en: they are in that condition of eager discomfort which passes for inspiration all admit radical changes of destination once the journey has begun;
sentences.native: 他们处于一种急切的不适状态，这种状态被视为灵感，一旦旅程开始，他们都会承认目的地发生根本性的变化。

sentences.en: one, to my certain knowledge, spent nine months on a novel about Kashmir,
sentences.native: 据我所知，其中一个花了九个月的时间写了一本关于克什米尔的小说，

sentences.en: then reset the whole thing in the Scottish Highlands.
sentences.native: 然后在苏格兰高地重置整个事情。

sentences.en: I never heard of anyone making a 'skeleton', as we were taught at school.
sentences.native: 我从来没有听说过有人制作“骷髅”，正如我们在学校所学到的那样。

sentences.en: In the breaking and remaking, in the timing interweaving, beginning afresh,
sentences.native: 在打破与重塑中，在时间的交织中，重新开始，

sentences.en: the writer comes to discern things in his material which were not consciously in his mind when he began.
sentences.native: 作者开始在他的材料中辨别出一些在他开始时并没有意识到的东西。

sentences.en: This organic process, often leading to moments of extraordinary self-discovery, is of an indescribable fascination.
sentences.native: 这种有机的过程往往会带来非凡的自我发现时刻，具有难以形容的魅力。

sentences.en: A blurred image appears; he adds a brushstroke and another and it is gone
sentences.native: 出现模糊的图像；他又加上了一笔又一笔，然后就消失了

sentences.en: but something was there, and he will not rest till he has captured it.
sentences.native: 但那里有东西，他不抓住它就不会休息。

sentences.en: Sometimes the yeast within a writer outlives a book he has written.
sentences.native: 有时，作家内心的酵母比他写的书还要长久。

sentences.en: I have heard of writers who read nothing but their own books;
sentences.native: 我听说过有些作家只读自己的书。

sentences.en: like adolescents they stand before the mirror,
sentences.native: 他们像青少年一样站在镜子前，

sentences.en: and still cannot fathom the exact outline of the vision before them.
sentences.native: 仍然无法理解眼前幻象的确切轮廓。

sentences.en: For the same reason, writers talk interminably about their own books,
sentences.native: 出于同样的原因，作家们没完没了地谈论自己的书，

sentences.en: winkling out hidden meanings, super-imposing new ones,
sentences.native: 揭示隐藏的含义，叠加新的含义，

sentences.en: begging response from those around them.
sentences.native: 请求周围人的回应。

sentences.en: Of course a writer doing this is misunderstood: he might as well try to explain a crime or a love affair.
sentences.native: 当然，这样做的作家会被误解：他还不如尝试解释犯罪或爱情。

sentences.en: He is also, incidentally, an unforgivable bore.
sentences.native: 顺便说一句，他也是一个不可原谅的讨厌鬼。

sentences.en: This temptation to cover the distance between himself and the reader,
sentences.native: 这种拉近自己与读者之间距离的诱惑，

sentences.en: to study his image in the sight of those who do not know him, can be his undoing: he has begun to write to please.
sentences.native: 研究他在那些不认识他的人眼中的形象，可能会导致他的毁灭：他已经开始为了取悦而写作。

sentences.en: A young English writer made the pertinent observation a year or two back
sentences.native: 一位年轻的英国作家在一两年前做出了相关的观察

sentences.en: that the talent goes into the first draft, and the art into the drafts that follow.
sentences.native: 人才进入初稿，艺术进入后续草稿。

sentences.en: For this reason also the writer, like any other artist,
sentences.native: 出于这个原因，作家也像其他艺术家一样，

sentences.en: has no resting place, no crowd or movement in which he may take comfort,
sentences.native: 没有休息的地方，没有人群或运动可以让他感到安慰，

sentences.en: no judgment from outside which can replace the judgment from within.
sentences.native: 任何外部的判断都不能取代内部的判断。

sentences.en: A writer makes order out of the anarchy of his heart;
sentences.native: 作家将内心的混乱整理得井井有条；

sentences.en: he submits himself to a more ruthless discipline than any critic dreamed of,
sentences.native: 他让自己受到比任何批评家所梦想的更残酷的纪律，

sentences.en: and when he flirts with fame, he is taking time off from living with himself,
sentences.native: 当他与名声调情时，他就从与自己相处的时间中抽出时间，

sentences.en: from the search for what his world contains at its inmost point.
sentences.native: 来自对他的世界最深处的探索。

sentences.en: Waves are the children of the struggle between ocean and atmosphere, the ongoing signatures of infinity.
sentences.native: 波浪是海洋和大气之间斗争的产物，是无限的持续特征。

sentences.en: Rays from the sun excite and energize the atmosphere of the earth, awakening it to flow, to movement, to rhythm, to life.
sentences.native: 来自太阳的光线激发并激发了地球的大气层，唤醒它的流动、运动、节奏和生命。

sentences.en: The wind then speaks the message of the sun to the sea
sentences.native: 然后风向大海传达太阳的信息

sentences.en: and the sea transmits it on through waves--an ancient, exquisite powerful message.
sentences.native: 大海通过波浪将它传递下去——这是一种古老而精致而有力的信息。

sentences.en: These ocean waves are among the earth's most complicated natural phenomena.
sentences.native: 这些海浪是地球上最复杂的自然现象之一。

sentences.en: The basic features include a crest (the highest point of the wave),
sentences.native: 基本特征包括波峰（波浪的最高点）、

sentences.en: a trough (the lowest point), a height (the vertical distance from the trough to the crest),
sentences.native: 波谷（最低点）、高度（波谷到波峰的垂直距离）、

sentences.en: a wave length (the horizontal distance between two wave crests),
sentences.native: 波长（两个波峰之间的水平距离），

sentences.en: and a period (which is the time it takes awave crest to travel one wave length).
sentences.native: 和一个周期（波峰传播一个波长所需的时间）。

sentences.en: Although an ocean wave gives the impression of a wall of water moving in your direction,
sentences.native: 尽管海浪给人的印象是一堵水墙朝您的方向移动，

sentences.en: in actuality waves move through the water leaving the water about where it was.
sentences.native: 事实上，波浪在水中移动，使水留在原来的位置。

sentences.en: If the water was moving with the wave,
sentences.native: 如果水随着波浪移动，

sentences.en: the ocean and everything on it would be racing in to the shore with obviously catastrophic results.
sentences.native: 海洋和海洋上的一切都会冲向海岸，带来明显的灾难性后果。

sentences.en: An ocean wave passing through deep water causes a particle on the surface to move in a roughly circular orbit,
sentences.native: 穿过深水的海浪使表面的粒子沿着大致圆形的轨道运动，

sentences.en: drawing the particle first towards the advancing wave, then up into the wave,
sentences.native: 首先将粒子拉向前进的波，然后向上进入波，

sentences.en: then forward with it and then--as the wave leaves the particles behind--back to its starting point again.
sentences.native: 然后继续前进，然后——当波将粒子抛在后面时——再次回到起点。

sentences.en: From both maturity to death, a wave is subject to the same laws as any other 'living' thing.
sentences.native: 从成熟到死亡，波浪与任何其他“生命”事物都遵循相同的法则。

sentences.en: For a time it assumes a miraculous individuality that, in the end, is reabsorbed into the great ocean of life.
sentences.native: 有一段时间，它呈现出一种神奇的个性，最终被重新吸收到生命的浩瀚海洋中。

sentences.en: The undulating waves of the open sea are generated by three natural causes:
sentences.native: 公海起伏的波浪是由三个自然原因产生的：

sentences.en: wind, earth movements or tremors, and the gravitational pull of the moon and the sun.
sentences.native: 风、地球运动或震动，以及月球和太阳的引力。

sentences.en: Once waves have been generated,
sentences.native: 一旦波浪产生，

sentences.en: gravity is the force that drives them in a continual attempt to restore the ocean surface to a flat plain.
sentences.native: 重力是驱使他们不断尝试将海洋表面恢复为平坦平原的力量。

sentences.en: Two main techniques have been used for training elephants, which we may call respectively the tough and the gentle.
sentences.native: 训练大象主要使用两种技术，我们可以分别称之为“强硬”和“温和”。

sentences.en: The former method simply consists of setting an elephant to work and beating him until he does what is expected of him.
sentences.native: 前一种方法只是让大象工作并殴打它，直到它完成预期的任务。

sentences.en: Apart from any moral considerations this is a stupid method of training,
sentences.native: 抛开任何道德考虑，这是一种愚蠢的训练方法，

sentences.en: for it produces a resentful animal who at a later stage may well turn man-killer.
sentences.native: 因为它会产生一种怨恨的动物，这种动物在后期很可能会变成杀人犯。

sentences.en: The gentle method requires more patience in the early stages,
sentences.native: 温和的方法前期需要更多的耐心，

sentences.en: but produce a cheerful good-tempered elephant who will give many years of loyal service.
sentences.native: 但会培育出一头性格开朗、脾气暴躁的大象，它将提供多年的忠诚服务。

sentences.en: The first essential in elephant training is to assign to the animal a single mahout who will be entirely responsible for the job.
sentences.native: 大象训练的首要任务是为大象指派一名驯象师，他将完全负责这项工作。

sentences.en: Elephants like to have one master just as dogs do, and are capable of a considerable degree of personal affection.
sentences.native: 大象和狗一样喜欢有一个主人，并且有相当程度的个人感情。

sentences.en: There are even stories of half-trained elephant calves who have refused to feed and pined to death
sentences.native: 甚至还有一些未经训练的小象因拒绝进食而死的故事

sentences.en: when by some unavoidable circumstance they have been deprived of their own trainer.
sentences.native: 由于某些不可避免的情况，他们被剥夺了自己的教练。

sentences.en: Such extreme cases must probably be taken with a grain of salt,
sentences.native: 对于这种极端情况，我们必须持保留态度，

sentences.en: but they do underline the general principle that the relationship between elephant and mahout is the key to successful training.
sentences.native: 但它们确实强调了一个普遍原则：大象和驯象师之间的关系是成功训练的关键。

sentences.en: The most economical age to capture an elephant for training is between 15 and 20 years,
sentences.native: 捕捉大象进行训练最经济的年龄是15岁到20岁之间，

sentences.en: for it is then almost ready to undertake heavy work and can begin to earn its keep straight away.
sentences.native: 因为那时它几乎已经准备好承担繁重的工作，并且可以立即开始赚钱。

sentences.en: But animals of this age do not easily become subservient to man, and a very firm hand must be employed in the early stages.
sentences.native: 但这个时代的动物不容易屈服于人类，在早期阶段必须采取非常严厉的手段。

sentences.en: The captive elephant, still roped to a tree,
sentences.native: 被俘虏的大象仍然被绳子拴在树上，

sentences.en: plunges and screams every time a man approaches, and for several days will probably refuse all food through anger and fear.
sentences.native: 每当有人靠近时，它就会跳下并尖叫，并且可能会在几天之内因愤怒和恐惧而拒绝所有食物。

sentences.en: Sometimes a tame elephant is tethered nearby to give the wild one confidence,
sentences.native: 有时，一头驯服的大象会被拴在附近，以给野生大象信心，

sentences.en: and in most cases the captive gradually quietens down and begins to accept its food.
sentences.native: 在大多数情况下，俘虏会逐渐安静下来并开始接受食物。

sentences.en: The next stage is to get the elephant to the training establishment,
sentences.native: 下一阶段是将大象带到训练场所，

sentences.en: a ticklish business which is achieved with the aid of two tame elephants roped to the captive on either side.
sentences.native: 这是一件棘手的事情，需要用绳子拴在两边的两只驯服的大象的帮助下才能完成。

sentences.en: When several elephants are being trained at one time,
sentences.native: 当多只大象同时接受训练时，

sentences.en: it is customary for the new arrival to be placed between the stalls of two captives whose training is already well advanced.
sentences.native: 按照惯例，新来的俘虏会被安置在两个已经受过充分训练的俘虏的畜栏之间。

sentences.en: It is then left completely undisturbed with plenty of food and water
sentences.native: 然后让它完全不受干扰，并提供充足的食物和水

sentences.en: so that it can absorb the atmosphere of its new home and see that nothing particularly alarming is happening to its companions.
sentences.native: 这样它就可以吸收新家的气氛，并看到它的同伴没有发生任何特别令人担忧的事情。

sentences.en: When it is eating normally, its own training begins.
sentences.native: 当它正常进食时，它自己的训练就开始了。

sentences.en: The trainer stands in front of the elephant holding a long stick with a sharp metal point.
sentences.native: 驯象师站在大象面前，手里拿着一根带有锋利金属尖的长棍。

sentences.en: Two assistants, mounted on tame elephants, control the captive from either side,
sentences.native: 两名助手骑在驯服的大象上，从两侧控制俘虏，

sentences.en: while others rub their hands over his skin to the accompaniment of a monotonous and soothing chant.
sentences.native: 其他人则伴随着单调而舒缓的圣歌，用手抚摸他的皮肤。

sentences.en: This is supposed to induce pleasurable sensations in the elephant,
sentences.native: 这应该会给大象带来愉悦的感觉，

sentences.en: and its effects are reinforced by the use of endearing epithets,
sentences.native: 并且通过使用可爱的绰号来强化其效果，

sentences.en: such as 'ho! my son', or 'ho! my father', or 'my mother', according to the age and sex of the captive.
sentences.native: 比如‘嗬！我的儿子”，或者“嗬！根据俘虏的年龄和性别，称其为“我的父亲”或“我的母亲”。

sentences.en: The elephant is not immediately susceptible to such blandishments, however, and usually lashes fiercely with its trunk in all directions.
sentences.native: 然而，大象不会立即受到这种甜言蜜语的影响，通常会用鼻子向各个方向猛烈地攻击。

sentences.en: These movements are controlled by the trainer with the metal-pointed stick,
sentences.native: 这些动作由训练者用金属尖头的棍子控制，

sentences.en: and the trunk eventually becomes so sore that the elephant curls it up and seldom afterwards uses it for offensive purposes.
sentences.native: 象鼻最终变得非常疼痛，以至于大象将其卷曲起来，之后很少将其用于攻击目的。

sentences.en: An earthquake comes like a thief in the night, without warning.
sentences.native: 地震就像夜间的小偷一样毫无预兆地来袭。

sentences.en: It was necessary, therefore, to invent instruments that neither slumbered nor slept.
sentences.native: 因此，有必要发明一种既不打盹也不睡觉的仪器。

sentences.en: Some devices were quite simple.
sentences.native: 有些设备非常简单。

sentences.en: One, for instance, consisted of rods of various lengths and thicknesses which would stand up on end like ninepins.
sentences.native: 例如，其中一种由不同长度和粗细的杆组成，这些杆可以像九瓶柱一样直立起来。

sentences.en: When a shock came, it shook the rigid table upon which these stood.
sentences.native: 当震动袭来时，这些东西所在的坚硬桌子都震动了。

sentences.en: If it were gentle, only the more unstable rods fell.
sentences.native: 如果动作轻柔，只有更不稳定的棒会掉落。

sentences.en: If it were severe, they all fell.
sentences.native: 如果严重的话，他们都会倒下。

sentences.en: Thus the rods, by falling, and by the direction in which they fell,
sentences.native: 因此，棒通过下落以及它们下落的方向，

sentences.en: recorded for the slumbering scientist the strength of a shock that was too weak to waken him,
sentences.native: 为沉睡的科学家记录了太弱而无法唤醒他的震动强度，

sentences.en: and the direction from which it came.
sentences.native: 以及它来自的方向。

sentences.en: But instruments far more delicate than that were needed if any really serious advance was to be made.
sentences.native: 但如果要取得任何真正重大的进展，就需要比这更精密的仪器。

sentences.en: The ideal to be aimed at was to devise an instrument that could record with a pen on paper,
sentences.native: 我们的理想目标是设计一种可以用笔在纸上记录的仪器，

sentences.en: the movements of the ground or of the table as the quake passed by.
sentences.native: 地震经过时地面或桌子的移动。

sentences.en: While I write my pen moves, but the paper keeps still.
sentences.native: 当我写字时，笔在动，但纸却保持静止。

sentences.en: With practice, no doubt, I could in time learn to write by holding the pen still while the paper moved.
sentences.native: 毫无疑问，通过练习，我很快就能学会在纸移动时握笔不动来写字。

sentences.en: That sounds a silly suggestion,
sentences.native: 这听起来是个愚蠢的建议

sentences.en: but that was precisely the idea adopted in some of the early instruments (seismometers) for recording earthquake waves.
sentences.native: 但这正是一些早期记录地震波的仪器（地震仪）所采用的想法。

sentences.en: But when table, penholder and paper are all moving, how is it possible to write legibly?
sentences.native: 但桌子、笔杆、纸都在动，怎么可能写得清楚呢？

sentences.en: The key to a solution of that problem lay in an everyday observation.
sentences.native: 解决这个问题的关键在于日常观察。

sentences.en: Why does a person standing in a bus or train tend to fall when a sudden start is made?
sentences.native: 为什么站在公交车或火车上的人突然启动时容易摔倒？

sentences.en: It is because his feet move on, but his head stays still.
sentences.native: 这是因为他的脚在前进，但他的头却保持静止。

sentences.en: A simple experiment will help us a little further.
sentences.native: 一个简单的实验将帮助我们更进一步。

sentences.en: Tie a heavy weight at the end of a long piece of string.
sentences.native: 在一根长绳子的末端系上一个重物。

sentences.en: With the hand held high in the air, hold the string so that the weight nearly touches the ground.
sentences.native: 手高举在空中，握住绳子，使重物几乎接触地面。

sentences.en: Now move the hand to and fro and around but not up and down.
sentences.native: 现在来回移动手，但不要上下移动。

sentences.en: It will be found that the weight moves but slightly or not at all.
sentences.native: 会发现重量有轻微移动或根本没有移动。

sentences.en: Imagine a pen attached to the weight in such a way that its point rests upon a piece of paper on the floor.
sentences.native: 想象一下，一支钢笔以这样一种方式连接到重物上，使其笔尖停留在地板上的一张纸上。

sentences.en: Imagine an earthquake shock shaking the floor, the paper, you and your hand.
sentences.native: 想象一下地震震动了地板、纸张、你和你的手。

sentences.en: In the midst of all this movement, the weight and the pen would be still.
sentences.native: 在所有这些运动过程中，重量和笔都是静止的。

sentences.en: But as the paper moved from side to side under the pen point, its movement would be recorded in ink upon its surface.
sentences.native: 但是，当纸张在笔尖下从一侧移动到另一侧时，其移动会被墨水记录在其表面上。

sentences.en: It was upon this principle that the first instruments were made, but the paper was wrapped round a drum which rotated slowly.
sentences.native: 正是根据这个原理，第一批乐器被制造出来，但纸被包裹在一个缓慢旋转的鼓上。

sentences.en: As long as all was still, the pen drew a straight line,
sentences.native: 只要一切安静，笔就画出一条直线，

sentences.en: but while the drum was being shaken, the line that the pen was drawing wriggled from side to side.
sentences.native: 但当鼓摇动时，笔所画的线就会左右蠕动。

sentences.en: The apparatus thus described, however,
sentences.native: 然而，如此描述的装置，

sentences.en: records only the horizontal component of the wave movement, which is, in fact, much more complicated.
sentences.native: 仅记录波浪运动的水平分量，这实际上要复杂得多。

sentences.en: If we could actually see the path described by a particle,
sentences.native: 如果我们真的能看到粒子所描述的路径，

sentences.en: such as a sand grain in the rock,
sentences.native: 比如岩石中的沙粒，

sentences.en: it would be more like that of a bluebottle buzzing round the room; it would be up and down, to and fro and from side to side.
sentences.native: 它更像是一只蓝瓶苍蝇在房间里嗡嗡作响；它会上下、前后、左右。

sentences.en: Instruments have been devised and can be so placed that all three elements can be recorded in different graphs.
sentences.native: 仪器的设计和放置可以使所有三个元素都可以记录在不同的图表中。

sentences.en: When the instrument is situated at more than 700 miles from the earthquake centre,
sentences.native: 当仪器位于距离地震中心超过 700 英里时，

sentences.en: the graphic record shows three waves arriving one after the other at short intervals.
sentences.native: 图形记录显示三个波浪以很短的间隔相继到达。

sentences.en: The first records the arrival of longitudinal vibrations.
sentences.native: 第一个记录纵向振动的到来。

sentences.en: The second marks the arrival of transverse vibrations which travel more slowly and arrive several minutes after the first.
sentences.native: 第二个标志着横向振动的到来，横向振动的传播速度较慢，并且在第一个振动后几分钟到达。

sentences.en: These two have travelled through the earth.
sentences.native: 这两个人已经穿越了地球。

sentences.en: It was from the study of these that so much was learnt about the interior of the earth.
sentences.native: 正是通过对这些的研究，我们对地球内部有了很多了解。

sentences.en: The third, or main wave is the slowest and has travelled round the earth through the surface rocks.
sentences.native: 第三波或主波是最慢的，并且通过地表岩石绕地球传播。

sentences.en: We must conclude from the work of those who have studied the origin of life,
sentences.native: 我们必须从那些研究生命起源的人的工作中得出结论：

sentences.en: that given a planet only approximately like our own, life is almost certain to start.
sentences.native: 假设有一个与我们地球大致相似的行星，生命几乎肯定会开始。

sentences.en: Of all the planets in our solar system, we are now pretty certain the Earth is the only one on which life can survive.
sentences.native: 在太阳系的所有行星中，我们现在非常确定地球是唯一一个有生命可以生存的行星。

sentences.en: Mars is too dry and poor in oxygen, Venus far too hot, and so is Mercury,
sentences.native: 火星太干燥且缺氧，金星太热，水星也是如此，

sentences.en: and the outer planets have temperatures near absolute zero and hydrogen-dominated atmospheres.
sentences.native: 外行星的温度接近零，大气层以氢为主。

sentences.en: But other suns, start as the astronomers call them, are bound to have planets like our own, and as is the number of stars in the universe is so vast,
sentences.native: 但是其他太阳，正如天文学家所说的那样，必然有像我们自己的行星，而且宇宙中恒星的数量是如此巨大，

sentences.en: this possibility becomes virtual certainty.
sentences.native: 这种可能性变成了事实上的确定性。

sentences.en: There are one hundred thousand million starts in our own Milky Way alone,
sentences.native: 仅在我们的银河系就有十亿颗恒星，

sentences.en: and then there are three thousand million other milky ways or galaxies, in the universe.
sentences.native: 宇宙中还有三亿个其他银河系或星系。

sentences.en: so the number of stars that we know exist is now estimated at about 300 million million million.
sentences.native: 因此，我们现在已知的恒星数量估计约为 3 亿颗。

sentences.en: Although perhaps only 1 percent of the life that has started somewhere will develop into highly complex and intelligent patterns,
sentences.native: 尽管也许只有百分之一的生命从某个地方开始会发展成高度复杂和智能的模式，

sentences.en: so vast is the number of planets, that intelligent life is bound to be a natural part of the universe.
sentences.native: 行星的数量如此之多，智慧生命必然是宇宙的自然组成部分。

sentences.en: If then we are so certain that other intelligent life exists in the universe, why have we had no visitors from outer space yet?
sentences.native: 如果我们如此确信宇宙中存在其他智慧生命，为什么我们还没有来自外太空的访客呢？

sentences.en: First of all, they may have come to this planet of ours thousands or millions of years ago,
sentences.native: 首先，他们可能在数千年或数百万年前就来到了我们这个星球，

sentences.en: and found our then prevailing primitive state completely uninteresting to their own advanced knowledge.
sentences.native: 他们发现我们当时盛行的原始状态对他们自己的先进知识完全不感兴趣。

sentences.en: Professor Ronald Bracewell, a leading American radio astronomer,
sentences.native: 罗纳德·布雷斯韦尔教授是美国著名射电天文学家，

sentences.en: argued in Nature that such a superior civilization, on a visit to our own solar system,
sentences.native: 《自然》杂志认为，这样一个高级文明在访问我们自己的太阳系时，

sentences.en: may have left an automatic messenger behind to await the possible awakening of an advanced civilization.
sentences.native: 可能留下了一个自动信使，等待先进文明的可能觉醒。

sentences.en: Such a messenger, receiving our radio and television signals,
sentences.native: 这样的使者，接收我们的广播电视信号，

sentences.en: might well re-transmit them back to its home-planet,
sentences.native: 很可能将它们重新传送回其母星，

sentences.en: although what impression any other civilization would thus get from us is best left unsaid.
sentences.native: 不过，最好不要说其他文明会给我们留下什么印象。

sentences.en: But here we come up against the most difficult of all obstacles to contact with people on other planets
sentences.native: 但在这里我们遇到了与其他星球上的人接触的最困难的障碍

sentences.en: -- the astronomical distances which separate us.
sentences.native: ——我们之间的天文距离。

sentences.en: As a reasonable guess, they might, on an average, be 100 light years away.
sentences.native: 根据合理的猜测，它们平均距离可能为 100 光年。

sentences.en: (A light year is the distance which light travels at 186, 000 miles per second in one year, namely 6 million million miles.)
sentences.native: （一光年是光在一年内以每秒 186, 000 英里的速度传播的距离，即 600 万英里。）

sentences.en: Radio waves also travel at the speed of light,
sentences.native: 无线电波也以光速传播，

sentences.en: and assuming such an automatic messenger picked up our first broadcasts of the 1920's,
sentences.native: 假设这样一个自动信使收到了我们 1920 年代的第一批广播，

sentences.en: the message to its home planet is barely halfway there.
sentences.native: 向其母星发出的信息才刚刚完成一半。

sentences.en: Similarly, our own present primitive chemical rockets,
sentences.native: 同样，我们现在的原始化学火箭，

sentences.en: though good enough to orbit men, have no chance of transporting us to the nearest other star,
sentences.native: 虽然足以绕人类运行，但没有机会将我们运送到最近的其他恒星，

sentences.en: four light years away, let alone distances of tens or hundreds of light years.
sentences.native: 四光年之外，更不用说几十、几百光年的距离了。

sentences.en: Fortunately, there is a 'uniquely rational way' for us to communicate with other intelligent beings,
sentences.native: 幸运的是，我们有一种“独特的理性方式”与其他智慧生物进行交流，

sentences.en: as Walter Sullivan has put it in his excellent book,
sentences.native: 正如沃尔特·沙利文（Walter Sullivan）在他的优秀著作中所说的那样，

sentences.en: We Are not Alone.
sentences.native: 我们并不孤单。

sentences.en: This depends on the precise radio frequency of the 21-cm wavelength, or 1420 megacycles per second.
sentences.native: 这取决于 21 厘米波长的精确射频，即每秒 1420 兆周期。

sentences.en: It is the natural frequency of emission of the hydrogen atoms in space and was discovered by us in 1951;
sentences.native: 它是氢原子在太空中发射的固有频率，由我们于1951年发现；

sentences.en: it must be known to any kind of radio astronomer in the universe.
sentences.native: 宇宙中任何类型的射电天文学家都必须知道它。

sentences.en: Once the existence of this wave-length had been discovered,
sentences.native: 一旦发现了这个波长的存在，

sentences.en: it was not long before its use as the uniquely recognizable broadcasting frequency for interstellar communication was suggested.
sentences.native: 不久之后，有人建议将其用作星际通信的唯一可识别的广播频率。

sentences.en: Without something of this kind,
sentences.native: 如果没有这样的东西，

sentences.en: searching for intelligences on other planets would be like trying to meet a friend in London without a pre-arranged rendezvous
sentences.native: 在其他行星上寻找情报就像试图在没有预先安排好的约会的情况下在伦敦会见朋友一样

sentences.en: and absurdly wandering the streets in the hope of a chance encounter.
sentences.native: 荒唐地在街上闲逛，希望能有一次偶遇。

sentences.en: Custom has not commonly been regarded as a subject of any great moment.
sentences.native: 习俗通常不被视为任何伟大时刻的主题。

sentences.en: The inner workings of our own brains we feel to be uniquely worthy of investigation,
sentences.native: 我们认为我们自己大脑的内部运作方式特别值得研究，

sentences.en: but custom, we have a way of thinking, is behaviour at is most commonplace.
sentences.native: 但习惯，我们有一种思维方式，是最平常的行为方式。

sentences.en: As a matter of fact, it is the other way around.
sentences.native: 事实上，情况恰恰相反。

sentences.en: Traditional custom, taken the world over,
sentences.native: 风靡世界的传统习俗，

sentences.en: is a mass of detailed behaviour more astonishing than what any one person can ever evolve in individual actions,
sentences.native: 是一系列详细的行为，比任何一个人在个人行为中所能演化出的行为更令人惊讶，

sentences.en: no matter how aberrant.
sentences.native: 无论多么异常。

sentences.en: Yet that is a rather trivial aspect of the matter.
sentences.native: 但这只是问题的一个相当微不足道的方面。

sentences.en: The fact of first-rate importance is the predominant role that custom plays in experience and in belief,
sentences.native: 最重要的事实是习俗在经验和信仰中发挥着主导作用，

sentences.en: and the very great varieties it may manifest.
sentences.native: 以及它可能表现出的非常丰富的多样性。

sentences.en: No man ever looks at the world with pristine eyes.
sentences.native: 没有人用纯净的眼睛看世界。

sentences.en: He sees it edited by a definite set of customs and institutions and ways of thinking.
sentences.native: 他认为它是由一套明确的习俗、制度和思维方式编辑的。

sentences.en: Even in his philosophical probings he cannot go behind these stereotypes;
sentences.native: 即使在他的哲学探索中，他也不能落后于这些刻板印象。

sentences.en: his very concepts of the true and the false will still have reference to his particular traditional customs.
sentences.native: 他对真与假的概念仍然与他特定的传统习俗有关。

sentences.en: John Dewey has said in all seriousness that the part played by custom in shaping the behaviour of the individual,
sentences.native: 约翰·杜威严肃地说，习俗在塑造个人行为方面所发挥的作用，

sentences.en: as against any way in which he can affect traditional custom,
sentences.native: 反对他以任何方式影响传统习俗，

sentences.en: is as the proportion of the total vocabulary of his mother tongue
sentences.native: 占其母语总词汇量的比例

sentences.en: against those words of his own baby talk that are taken up into the vernacular of his family.
sentences.native: 反对他自己的儿语中那些被纳入他家庭方言的话语。

sentences.en: When one seriously studies the social orders that have had the opportunity to develop autonomously,
sentences.native: 当一个人认真研究有机会自主发展的社会秩序时，

sentences.en: the figure becomes no more than an exact and matter-of-fact observation.
sentences.native: 这个数字只不过是一个精确而实事求是的观察。

sentences.en: The life history of the individual is first and foremost an accommodation
sentences.native: 个人的生活史首先是一种适应

sentences.en: to the patterns and standards traditionally handed down in his community.
sentences.native: 遵守社区传统上流传下来的模式和标准。

sentences.en: From the moment of his birth,
sentences.native: 从他出生的那一刻起，

sentences.en: the customs into which he is born shape his experience and behaviour.
sentences.native: 他出生的习俗塑造了他的经历和行为。

sentences.en: By the time he can talk, he is the little creature of his culture,
sentences.native: 当他能说话的时候，他已经是他的文化中的小生物了，

sentences.en: and by the time he is grown and able to take part in its activities,
sentences.native: 当他长大并能够参加其活动时，

sentences.en: its habits are his habits, its beliefs his beliefs, its impossibilities his impossibilities.
sentences.native: 它的习惯就是他的习惯，它的信念就是他的信念，它的不可能就是他的不可能。

sentences.en: Every child that is born into his group will share them with him,
sentences.native: 每个出生在他的群体中的孩子都会与他分享，

sentences.en: and no child born into one on the opposite side of the globe can ever achieve the thousandth part.
sentences.native: 在地球另一端出生的孩子不可能达到千分之一。

sentences.en: There is no social problem it is more incumbent upon us to understand than this of the role of custom.
sentences.native: 没有什么社会问题比习俗的作用更值得我们去理解了。

sentences.en: Until we are intelligent as to its laws and varieties,
sentences.native: 直到我们了解它的规律和种类之前，

sentences.en: the main complicating facts of human life must remain unintelligible.
sentences.native: 人类生活中主要的复杂事实必须仍然难以理解。

sentences.en: The study of custom can be profitable only after certain preliminary propositions have been accepted,
sentences.native: 只有在某些初步主张被接受后，对习俗的研究才能有利可图，

sentences.en: and some of these propositions have been violently opposed.
sentences.native: 其中一些主张遭到了强烈反对。

sentences.en: In the first place, any scientific study requires that there be no
sentences.native: 首先，任何科学研究都要求不存在

sentences.en: preferential weighting of one or another of the items in the series it selects for its consideration.
sentences.native: 它选择考虑的系列中的一个或另一个项目的优先权重。

sentences.en: In all the less controversial fields, like the study of cacti or termites or the nature of nebulae,
sentences.native: 在所有争议较小的领域，例如仙人掌、白蚁或星云性质的研究，

sentences.en: the necessary method of study is to group the relevant material and to take note of all possible variant forms and conditions.
sentences.native: 必要的研究方法是将相关材料分组并注意所有可能的变体形式和条件。

sentences.en: In this way, we have learned all that we know of the laws of astronomy, or of the habits of the social insects, let us say.
sentences.native: 通过这种方式，我们已经了解了所有我们所知道的天文学定律，或者说，社会性昆虫的习性。

sentences.en: It is only in the study of man himself that the major social sciences
sentences.native: 主要的社会科学只有在对人本身的研究中

sentences.en: have substituted the study of one local variation, that of Western civilization.
sentences.native: 取代了对一种地方变异的研究，即西方文明的研究。

sentences.en: Anthropology was by definition impossible,
sentences.native: 人类学从定义上来说是不可能的，

sentences.en: as long as these distinctions between ourselves and the primitive,
sentences.native: 只要我们和原始人之间的这些区别存在，

sentences.en: ourselves and the barbarian, ourselves and the pagan, held sway over people's minds.
sentences.native: 我们自己和野蛮人，我们自己和异教徒，统治着人们的思想。

sentences.en: It was necessary first to arrive at that degree of sophistication
sentences.native: 首先必须达到那种复杂程度

sentences.en: where we no longer set our own belief against our neighbour's superstition.
sentences.native: 在那里，我们不再将自己的信仰与邻居的迷信相对立。

sentences.en: It was necessary to recognize that these institutions which are based on the same premises, let us say the supernatural,
sentences.native: 有必要认识到，这些机构基于相同的前提，让我们说超自然的，

sentences.en: must be considered together, our own among the rest.
sentences.native: 必须将我们自己的问题与其他问题一起考虑。

sentences.en: In man's early days, competition with other creatures must have been critical.
sentences.native: 在人类早期，与其他生物的竞争一定是至关重要的。

sentences.en: But this phase of our development is now finished.
sentences.native: 但我们的这一阶段的开发现已结束。

sentences.en: Indeed, we lack practice and experience nowadays in dealing with primitive conditions.
sentences.native: 事实上，我们现在缺乏处理原始条件的实践和经验。

sentences.en: I am sure that, without modern weapons,
sentences.native: 我确信，如果没有现代武器，

sentences.en: I would make a very poor show of disputing the ownership of a cave with a bear, and in this I do not think that I stand alone.
sentences.native: 我会表现得非常糟糕，与一只熊争论洞穴的所有权，在这方面我不认为我是孤立的。

sentences.en: The last creature to compete with man was the mosquito.
sentences.native: 最后一个与人类竞争的生物是蚊子。

sentences.en: But even the mosquito has been subdued by attention to drainage and by chemical sprays.
sentences.native: 但即使是蚊子也因注意排水和化学喷雾而被抑制住了。

sentences.en: Competition between ourselves, person against person,
sentences.native: 我们之间、人与人之间的竞争，

sentences.en: community against community, still persists, however; and it is as fierce as it ever was.
sentences.native: 然而，社区对抗社区的现象仍然存在；而且还是一如既往的猛烈。

sentences.en: But the competition of man against man is not the simple process envisioned in biology.
sentences.native: 但人与人之间的竞争并不是生物学中想象的简单过程。

sentences.en: It is not a simple competition for a fixed amount of food determined by the physical environment,
sentences.native: 这不是简单的争夺由物理环境决定的固定数量的食物，

sentences.en: because the environment that determines our evolution is no longer essentially physical.
sentences.native: 因为决定我们进化的环境本质上不再是物理的。

sentences.en: Our environment is chiefly conditoned by the things we believe.
sentences.native: 我们的环境主要取决于我们所信仰的事物。

sentences.en: Morocco and California are bits of the Earth in very similar latitudes,
sentences.native: 摩洛哥和加利福尼亚是地球上纬度非常相似的地方，

sentences.en: both on the west coasts of continents with similar climates, and probably with rather similar natural resources.
sentences.native: 两者都位于气候相似的大陆西海岸，而且可能拥有相当相似的自然资源。

sentences.en: Yet their present development is wholly different,
sentences.native: 但他们现在的发展却截然不同，

sentences.en: not so much because of different people even,
sentences.native: 甚至不是因为不同的人，

sentences.en: but because of the different thoughts that exist in the minds of their inhabitants.
sentences.native: 而是因为居民心中存在着不同的想法。

sentences.en: This is the point I wish to emphasize.
sentences.native: 这是我想强调的一点。

sentences.en: The most important factor in our environment is the state of our own minds.
sentences.native: 我们的环境中最重要的因素是我们自己的心态。

sentences.en: It is well known that where the white man has invaded a primitive culture,
sentences.native: 众所周知，在白人入侵原始文化的地方，

sentences.en: the most destructive effects have come not from physical weapons but from ideas.
sentences.native: 最具破坏性的影响不是来自物理武器，而是来自思想。

sentences.en: Ideas are dangerous.
sentences.native: 想法是危险的。

sentences.en: The Holy Office knew this full well when it caused heretics to be burned in days gone by.
sentences.native: 神圣办公室在过去导致异端分子被烧死的时候就清楚地知道这一点。

sentences.en: Indeed, the concept of free speech only exists in our modern society because when you are inside a community,
sentences.native: 确实，言论自由的概念只存在于我们现代社会，因为当你在一个社区内时，

sentences.en: you are conditioned by the conventions of the community to such a degree that it is very difficult to conceive of anything really destructive.
sentences.native: 你受到社区惯例的限制，以至于很难想象出任何真正具有破坏性的事情。

sentences.en: It is only someone looking on from outside that can inject the dangerous thoughts.
sentences.native: 只有旁观者才能注入危险的想法。

sentences.en: I do not doubt that it would be possible to inject ideas into the modern world that would utterly destroy us.
sentences.native: 我毫不怀疑，向现代世界注入会彻底摧毁我们的思想是可能的。

sentences.en: I would like to give you an example, but fortunately I cannot do so.
sentences.native: 我想给你举个例子，但幸运的是我不能这样做。

sentences.en: Perhaps it will suffice to mention the nuclear bomb.
sentences.native: 也许只要提一下核弹就足够了。

sentences.en: Imagine the effect on a reasonably advanced technological society,
sentences.native: 想象一下这对一个相当先进的技术社会的影响，

sentences.en: one that still does not possess the bomb, of making it aware of the possibility, of supplying suffcient details to enable the thing to be constructed.
sentences.native: 一个仍然没有拥有炸弹的人，一个让其意识到可能性的人，一个提供足够细节以使其能够建造的人。

sentences.en: 20 or 30 pages of information handed to any of the major world powers around the year 1925,
sentences.native: 1925年左右交给世界任何主要强国的20或30页信息，

sentences.en: would have been sufficient to change the course of world history.
sentences.native: 足以改变世界历史的进程。

sentences.en: It is a strange thought, but I believe a correct one,
sentences.native: 这是一个奇怪的想法，但我相信这是正确的，

sentences.en: that twenty or thirty pages of ideas and information would be capable of turning the present-day world upside down, or even destroying it.
sentences.native: 二十或三十页的想法和信息将能够颠覆当今世界，甚至摧毁它。

sentences.en: I have often tried to conceive of what those pages might contain,
sentences.native: 我经常尝试设想这些页面可能包含什么内容，

sentences.en: but of course I cannot do so because I am a prisoner of the present-day world, just as all of you are.
sentences.native: 但我当然不能这样做，因为我和你们一样，是当今世界的囚徒。

sentences.en: We cannot think outside the particular patterns that our brains are conditioned to, or,
sentences.native: 我们不能在我们的大脑所适应的特定模式之外思考，或者，

sentences.en: to be more accurate we can think only a very little way outside and then only if we are very original.
sentences.native: 更准确地说，我们只能在非常有创意的情况下思考外面的事情。

sentences.en: A gifted American psychologist has said, 'Worry is a spasm of the emotion;
sentences.native: 一位才华横溢的美国心理学家曾说过：“忧虑是一种情绪的痉挛；忧虑是一种情绪的痉挛；忧虑是情绪的痉挛。

sentences.en: the mind catches hold of something and will not let it go.'
sentences.native: 头脑抓住某些东西并且不会放开它。

sentences.en: It is useless to argue with the mind in this condition.
sentences.native: 在这种情况下与头脑争论是没有用的。

sentences.en: The stronger the will, the more futile the task.
sentences.native: 意志越坚强，任务就越徒劳。

sentences.en: One can only gently insinuate something else into its convulsive grasp.
sentences.native: 一个人只能轻轻地将其他东西引入它的痉挛之中。

sentences.en: And if this something else is rightly chosen, if it is really attended by the illumination of another field of interest,
sentences.native: 如果这个别的东西选择正确，如果它确实伴随着另一个感兴趣领域的启发，

sentences.en: gradually, and often quite swiftly, the old undue grip relaxes and the process of recuperation and repair begins.
sentences.native: 逐渐地，通常很快，旧有的不适当的束缚就会放松，恢复和修复的过程就开始了。

sentences.en: The cultivation of a hobby and new forms of interest is therefore a policy of the first importance to a public man.
sentences.native: 因此，培养一种爱好和新的兴趣形式对于公众人士来说是最重要的政策。

sentences.en: But this is not a business that can be undertaken in a day or swiftly improvised by a mere command of the will.
sentences.native: 但这不是一天就能完成的事情，也不是仅仅靠意志就能迅速完成的事情。

sentences.en: The growth of alternative mental interests is a long process.
sentences.native: 另类心理兴趣的成长是一个漫长的过程。

sentences.en: The seeds must be carefully chosen; they must fall on good ground;
sentences.native: 种子必须经过精心挑选；他们必须落在良好的基础上；

sentences.en: they must be sedulously tended, if the vivifying fruits are to be at hand when needed.
sentences.native: 如果要在需要时获得充满活力的果实，就必须精心照料它们。

sentences.en: To be really happy and really safe, one ought to have at least two or three hobbies, and they must all be real.
sentences.native: 要想真正快乐、真正安全，一个人至少应该有两到三种爱好，而且它们都必须是真实的。

sentences.en: It is no use starting late in life to say: 'I will take an interest in this or that.'
sentences.native: 在晚年才说：“我会对这个或那个感兴趣”是没有用的。

sentences.en: Such an attempt only aggravates the strain of mental effort.
sentences.native: 这种尝试只会加剧脑力劳动的压力。

sentences.en: A man may acquire great knowledge of topics unconnected with his daily work, and yet get hardly any benefit or relief.
sentences.native: 一个人可能会获得与日常工作无关的大量知识，但几乎得不到任何好处或缓解。

sentences.en: It is no use doing what you like; you have got to like what you do.
sentences.native: 做自己喜欢的事是没有用的；你必须喜欢你所做的事情。

sentences.en: Broadly speaking, human beings may be divided into three classes:
sentences.native: 从广义上讲，人类可以分为三类：

sentences.en: those who are toiled to death, those who are worried to death, and those who are bored to death.
